HOW THE HELL YOU PICK THIS MOMENT
END CREDITS SEQUENCE. STILL IN DARKNESS
THE BLADE CATCHES HIM IN THE CHEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stone walls. Gun towers. Razor wire. A formidable hellhol

dialogues.speaker: SUPER
dialogues.text: A KAWASAKI NINJA 300 FLIES UP to the prison gates. TWO GUARDS watch as a silky figure climbs off the bike an removes her helmet to reveal a gorgeous head of red hair. Dialogue in ITALICS is in ALBANIAN with ENGLISH SUBTITLES

dialogues.speaker: GATE GUARD
dialogues.text: You lose your way?

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: No, I’m right where I need to be. She unzips her jacket. Is she gonna flash them? But then pulls out two ENVELOPES. Confused, the guards open them up. They’re filled with AMERICAN DOLLARS.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Aleksander Luga. Inmate 2-1-9-5. I want him free. The guards trade looks. Go to hand the money back.

dialogues.speaker: GATE GUARD
dialogues.text: Get the fuck out of here.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Just know... We gave you the easy way out. Twin precision shots rip through the guards foreheads. IN FLASH: AN EXTRACTION TEAM emerges from the treeline. The girl pulls control keys from a guard’s pocket. Steps a security shack. Disarms security and opens a side gate. Wearing night vision goggles and carrying Geind SMS-65 submachine guns, the gunmen enter the prison with militar precision, THE ENTIRE CHARGE SEEN IN NIGHT VISION GREEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An inmate is doing push-ups. With one arm. In a handstand His body is lean. Covered in tats. One for each kill. His head is shaved. He is as dangerous as they come. He is ALEKSANDER LUGA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The extraction team makes their way through the prison. A gunman attaches an explosive to a lock. BLOWS FREE the do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gunman cuts wires to the electrical grid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights SHUT OFF -- leaving guards vulnerable to the extraction team, wearing night vision. They CUT THEM DOWN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hallway door EXPLODES. TEAM LEADER crosses up to Luga cell. Attaches another charge to the door. It blows open. Luga steps out. Instantly demands:

dialogues.speaker: LUGA
dialogues.text: Give me a gun. The gunman hands him a Glock 30. Luga sees two guards rus up and FIRES -- killing them both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MERLIN HELICOPTER shoots towards the prison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The extraction team commences exfil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopter touches down inside the walls. Luga and th extraction team hop inside. It flies off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large building on the Indian River in Florida.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARDHA, a tough Albanian, hands a cheap phone to his boss ALBERT HESS, 50's, serious and intelligent. Into the phon

dialogues.speaker: HESS
dialogues.text: Put him on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luga takes the phone from the Lead Team Member.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know who this is?

dialogues.speaker: LUGA
dialogues.text: I got your message.

dialogues.speaker: HESS
dialogues.text: Good -- then you know I only got you out for one reason. This is not a personal job. It’s business. You’re to do what I hired you to do and nothing more. Tell me you understand that.

dialogues.speaker: LUGA
dialogues.text: ...I understand. Luga hangs up. Stares ahead. Cold eyes. Hard. END INTERCU

dialogues.speaker: HESS
dialogues.text: (to Bardha) I need to keep this dog on a short leash. Make sure he’s brought to me the second he gets off the boat. Hess sends the phone down a chute -- into an incinerator.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: flying off -- as RAP MUSIC BLASTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOOTING over neon-lit water, we pan up to frame the MIAM SKYLINE, the sonic WHOOSH of a 6262cc V12 engine as we GO

dialogues.speaker: A GUN-GRAY FERRARI 599
dialogues.text: THUNDERING past Miami hot-spots. Behind the wheel, dresse like a GQ cover model: MIKE LOWERY. A Lamborghini Huracan pulls up beside him at a red light, two IMG MODELS inside

dialogues.speaker: IMG MODEL
dialogues.text: Sweet ride. She REVS the engine.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: You two aren’t silly enough to want to race me.

dialogues.speaker: IMG MODEL
dialogues.text: ...Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: IMG MODEL
dialogues.text: ..-Depends how big your engine is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big enough for two. What do you have under the hood?

dialogues.speaker: IMG MODEL
dialogues.text: Catch us and you'll find out.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Would if I could, but I got work. I‘1l have to find you ladies later.

dialogues.speaker: IMG MODEL
dialogues.text: And how do you plan to do that? Mike flashes his BADGE. Girls smile. The light turns gree They ZOOM AHEAD. Mike mouths “damn” and ROARS forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A luxury shopping center. Mike’s Ferrari pulls up and par

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike checks his Hublot King Power Black Mamba watch.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Alright, it’s almost game time. Daltrey, Sanchez, you two set? This to a HIDDEN MICROPHONE in the lining of the car ceil

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parked a few cars away from Mike. Sitting inside are two generation cops with MIAMI-DADE PD’S TACTICAL NARCOTICS T SCOTT DALTREY (Louisiana-transplant; ex-Marine; Duck Dyna beard; the guy you want backing you in a firefight) and M SANCHEZ (Latina; sexy; teflon-tough). Both cops are wired with MICS near their throats so they talk without holding up a radio.

dialogues.speaker: DALTREY
dialogues.text: Ready to rumble, hoss.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Theroux, where are you at?

dialogues.speaker: CAM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Right behind you partner. Wait, partner? What happened to Marcus Burnett? Mike looks in the rear-view at the sweet-looking Dodge Challenger SRT8 behind him. The driver gives a wave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meet Mike’s new partner: CAM THEROUX, young and cocky.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Nice of your connection to pick this place to meet. I say after we bust the bad guys, we do a little shopping, a candle from Wicks N Sticks, maybe grab some Cinnabon. Daltrey, some new bandanas?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Hey, you wanna do your job or you wanna fuck around? Cam gets quiet quick.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now let’s go over it again: as soon as I agree to the buy, I give the call to Theroux to show up with the green. Once we got the glass in hand: Daltrey, Sanchez, you two come in hard and fast, back us up. No call, you’re all statues unless I give the trouble signal. Any questions?

dialogues.speaker: SANCHEZ
dialogues.text: Yeah. What’s the trouble signal?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: “Oh shit, I’m in trouble.” Now let’s get sharp. It’s prove yourself time. Cam resents Mike’s condescending attitude. Under his brea

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Prove yourself, my ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stores are closing. Mike and the TNT cops are still waiti

dialogues.speaker: DALTREY
dialogues.text: C’mon, top 3 country songs. Go.

dialogues.speaker: SANCHEZ
dialogues.text: They're all the same. If it's not about cheating, it's about drinking. Or screwing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that’s different from what you listen to? It’s all about Kush, bitches and doe. Sanchez sits up. Spots a mousey WHITE GUY heading toward Mike’s car. Into her mic:

dialogues.speaker: SANCHEZ
dialogues.text: Lowery, heads-up. Mike sees the white guy approaching. His connection.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: That's him. Get ready. Cam zips open a gym bag on the passenger seat. A Strayer Voight Infinity TIKI handgun rests atop wrapped stacks of bills. He discretely pulls out the gun. Mike gets ready to step out of his Ferrari but the connec doesn’t slow down. Just keeps walking up to Mike’s car -- -- and drops a PRE-PAID CELL onto Mike’s lap. Cam, Daltrey and Sanchez are all thrown. Mike was suppose meet him in the open. Mike sees the connection vanish into the shadows of the parking lot, then picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE ON PHONE
dialogues.text: We need to change locations.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: What are you talkin’ about? This is where we agreed to meet.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE ON PHONE
dialogues.text: Not anymore. You want what we’re selling, you come to us. Club Apagén. Be there in twenty minutes. Bring the cash to the VIP section. Come alone. CLICK. The call ends. Back into his mic:

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Alright, change of plan. We're goin’ clubbing. Meet’s at a place called Apagén. Sanchez instantly gets on her phone and runs a search.

dialogues.speaker: SANCHEZ
dialogues.text: After hours joint in Little Havana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn set-up.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: C’mon Mike, you're not serious. That’s an invitation to a hit. You gotta call this off.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Not callin’ anything off. (urgent) Sanchez, Daltrey: beat us to the club. Make sure you got eyes and ears in place when the deal goes down. Daltrey and Sanchez immediately drive away in the Escalad

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Theroux, you hold back out front with the money and don’t release it until you get the call from me. You got it? Cam’s not happy -- but Mike’s the senior officer here.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Yeah, I got it. Mike drives off. Cam shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: CAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Goddammit Lowery. And starts up his ride. LATIN TECHNO BLASTS as we GO TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An EXPLOSION OF SOUND AND LASER LIGHT. Lots of skin. Miam YOUNGEST AND HOTTEST dance around acrobatic salsa perform and bikini-clad conga dancers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under the I-95 overpass in Little Havana. The Escalade pa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daltrey turns to see Sanchez STRIPPING in the passenger s

dialogues.speaker: DALTREY
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: SANCHEZ
dialogues.text: Same thing you should be. This is a club, not a Waffle House.  Sanchez removes her jacket and shirt to reveal a lacy camisole. Daltrey takes off an outer-shirt, throws off hi bandanna and messes up his hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking club-hot, Sanchez and Daltrey step inside. Play t role of boyfriend and girlfriend. Hands all over each oth The two cops take up position so they have line of sight the GLASS ENCASED VIP AREA.

dialogues.speaker: DALTREY
dialogues.text: (into a hidden mic) All ready Mike, you’re good to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike arrives, followed by Cam, who watches Mike enter the club, still thinking he’s nuts to do so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike crosses underneath LATIN DANCERS GYRATING in CAGES t the VIP SECTION. FIVE MEN await him, standing. A beefy SECURITY OFFICER ru wand over Mike. He’s clean. Daltrey and Sanchez watch as Mike steps inside the VIP ar But as soon as the glass door closes behind him -- -- the glass turns FROSTED. Sanchez and Daltrey can’t see

dialogues.speaker: SANCHEZ
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DALTREY
dialogues.text: We can’t see inside. Cam shifts, uneasy.

dialogues.speaker: SUDDENLY
dialogues.text: The five men are members of a cruel and merciless HOME INVASION CREW that specializes in ripping off drug buyers

dialogues.speaker: LEAD GUNMAN
dialogues.text: Put your fucking hands up mother- fucker!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, let’s dial this shit down. The LEAD GUNMAN steps forward, threatening:

dialogues.speaker: LEAD GUNMAN
dialogues.text: Where’s the fucking money!?!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: There is no fucking money.

dialogues.speaker: LEAD GUNMAN
dialogues.text: Call your boy and get us our money or we kill your ass! A GUNMAN presses a Glock into his temple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hearing this, Cam grabs the gym bag off the passenger sea throws open his door and crosses the parking lot to the c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Despite the guns aimed at him, Mike keeps cool.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: How about you all go fuck yourselves instead?

dialogues.speaker: LEAD GUNMAN
dialogues.text: What the fuck did you say to me, asshole?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: The money is what's keeping me alive. You get that, then what? No. We do this, we do it my way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cam gets intercepted by the bouncer -- his gun bulge visi

dialogues.speaker: BOUNCER
dialogues.text: Club’s full, homie. Cam drops the bag, grabs the bouncer’s hand and elbow, presses them together, KICKS out his knee and SLAMS his h against the wall. The bouncer’s out-cold. He pulls out th bouncer’s radio headset and pockets his cell phone and gu Then picks back up the gym bag and moves into the club.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Now put your guns down, show me the glass and we can make this happen.  10.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanchez and Daltrey see Cam go to the VIP area.

dialogues.speaker: SANCHEZ
dialogues.text: Where the fuck’s he going? Lowery hasn't given the signal yet.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: If not, just shoot me now cause you’re not gonna see dime one of that fucking money. Cam SLAMS his hand on the door outside.

dialogues.speaker: CAM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey, open up, I got your money! Mike rolls his eyes. Asshole. No choice -- Mike KNOCKS away the gun that’s pressed to his temple whi quick-drawing a SECOND GLOCK out of the gunman’s pants. He aims it at the leader as another CREW MEMBER FIRES. Mi uses his gunman as a HUMAN SHIELD, trading bullets. The g wall SHATTERS!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cam draws the bouncer’s gun and starts laying down cover fire. Mike escapes the VIP section. TWO MORE GANG MEMBERS run from the main area of the club. before they can shoot at Mike and Cam -- BANG! BANG! BANG Daltrey and Sanchez take them out. It’s an ALL OUT GUN BATTLE -- bullets shooting electrical equipment -- CAUSING SPARKS and FIRE. WATER GUSHES out of sprinklers. Everyone gets DRENCHED. The Lead Gunman goes for an exit. Mike CHARGES after him. Another SHOOTER takes aim, but before he can fire -- his EXPLODES. REVEAL: CAM -- having just taken the kill shot. Mike gets closer to the Lead Gunman -- who whips around, FIRING at Mike, who then SLIDES across the wet floor, leg STRIKING the Lead Gunman, who drops onto his back. Mike swings the gun right into his face.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Like I said: my way.  11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aftermath. Fire trucks. Cruisers. A Crown Victoria pulls CAPTAIN LEO HOWARD steps out. Surveys the chaos and zeroe on the man responsible: Mike, currently fighting with Cam

dialogues.speaker: MIKE CAM
dialogues.text: You disobeyed a direct order! They were gonna kill you!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: What you did was put the whole crew at risk! As tensions reach a fever pitch, Howard comes walking up.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN HOWARD
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, this looks about right for one of your Thursdays. Wait, can that be? Oh my God yes, the building’s still standing. You must be losing your touch, Mike.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Captain, before you start in --

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN HOWARD
dialogues.text: Over here. Mike follows Howard away from Cam and the others.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Look it’s not my fault that things got out of hand this time.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN HOWARD
dialogues.text: Of course not. It was “ABM’s” fault. Anyone But Mike’s. You said this was gonna be a routine buy.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Which it would have been if Theroux listened --

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN HOWARD
dialogues.text: Wait, someone didn’t listen to you? I’m sorry ‘CAUSE I HAVE NO IDEA WHAT THAT’S LIKE! You know, ever since the “Bad Boys” broke up, you're like my nephew without Ritalin. You weren’t a one man army doing everything the way you want. So I’m telling you now: you better learn how to be part of a fucking team again. Howard walks away. OFF MIKE -- fuck that, MUSIC and GO TO  12.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sun breaks, casting morning rays over the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front door flies open, letting in a walking rack of D CLEANING. A dog rushes in and undercuts the mess, trippin the person in the center: MARCUS BURNETT.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Oh shit!

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Baby, that you? He falls, and the dog tramples the clothes.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did you remember the dry-cleaning?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Uh-huh! (to the dog) Go, scoot, away. Past the open rumpus room door, a phone is ringing. INT. BURNETT HOUSE - “RUMPUS ROOM” - MOMENTS LATER Which has been converted into a combination gym/home offi On the treadmill, JAMES BURNETT, 16, has just answered th phone. QUINCY, 15, reads a men’s fitness magazine.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Hello, B.S. Unlimited!

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: (entering) James! No, no, man. How many times do I have to tell you: it’s not B.S. unlimited. It’s “Burnett Services Unlimited. Private Investigator.”

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I think B.S. makes more sense. Marcus snatches the phone. Clears his throat.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Good morning. Burnett Services Unlimited. He scrambles for something to write on. Quincy hands him torn-out page from his magazine. It’s an ad for MALE BOTO  13. “Because you’ve only got one face. BRO-TOX.” The tight fa of a middle-aged man peers back. Marcus leers at Quincy.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're adopted. (into the phone) Yes, ma’am, I got thirty years of investigative experience. Narcotics, Murder One, kidnapping, human trafficking. Seen it all. (crestfallen) Oh, your husband came home late? He begins writing notes onto the BRO-TOX AD. MARCUS (CONT’D) No ma‘am, there is no sin too big or too small for Marcus Burnett.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus walks in on wife THERESA hugging their 22 year-old daughter, MEGAN.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: ...JjJust make sure you break it to dad gently.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Break what to dad gently? Megan turns to Marcus. Smiles.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh shit.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA MEGAN
dialogues.text: Marcus! Dad!

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, baby. That was just a reflex. I’m here now... What were you gonna say?

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: I'm --

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Oh shit!

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Marcus!

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Theresa, what do you want from me? Our little girl wants to go off and marry that idiot, Clark.  14.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Dad, I’m not marrying Clark.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Damn right you’re not.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: I’m having his baby.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Oh hell no.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Marcus --

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Theresa, excuse me, but no way. First off, Clark’s unemployed --

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: He’s not unemployed. He works at home. He does freelance.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: You know who also does freelance at home? Hookers. And I wouldn’t want them to be my baby’s baby daddy either.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: (storming past him) You're unbelievable.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Megan!

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Good one, baby. Real slick. Theresa follows her now-crying daughter. Marcus looks dow He still has the BRO-TOX AD in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: What are you looking at? A beat as the picture catches his gaze again. Lingers the He doesn’t break. Wait, is Marcus considering “Bro-Tox?” EXT. MEDITERRANEAN SEA —- DAY A cargo ship trudges over choppy waters, spewing smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ship see-sawing, Luga shaves his beard -- dry. Looks ina small mirror at his new face, still menacing.  15. INT. MIKE’S PENTHOUSE APARTMENT - MORNING Panning across the ultimate bachelor pad, we pick up piec of clothes. Shoes. Pants. Then a skirt. A bra. We hear a shower running as we land on Mike, asleep in be The phone RINGS, waking him. He picks it up, answering:

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Lowery... Yeah, alright. I’1l be there in twenty. An arm drapes over him. Belongs to IMG MODEL #1 from the opening, a pair of HANDCUFFS dangling from her wrist.

dialogues.speaker: IMG MODEL
dialogues.text: Don’t tell me you’re leaving me again.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Sorry, baby. Duty calls.

dialogues.speaker: IMG MODEL
dialogues.text: But we haven't posted bail yet. Mike looks to the BATHROOM where IMG MODEL #2 has just emerged from the shower, naked and wet. But whereas before, Mike would mouth “damn”, now he looks...bored. Has the bachelor life become too routine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike’s Ferrari roars up. Parks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike crosses the lobby to the elevator. As the doors shut

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Hold the elevator. Mike stops the doors from closing to reveal LT. ELLIE GARRISON, strong-willed and beautiful. Even her conservat business suit can’t diminish the luster she gives off.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: (stepping inside) Sergeant.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Lieutenant. Ellie hits the button for 6. Mike has already pressed 8. Ellie is the only woman in Miami who won’t succumb to Mik charm -- but that hasn't stopped him from trying.  16.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hear the brass wants you to head up Vice. Congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Sure Howard’s gonna miss having you as his #2. If you want I could help you celebrate.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: I don’t think so.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: You know one of these days you’re gonna surprise me and say yes.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: And one of these days you’re gonna surprise me and say nothing. The elevator stops at Ellie’s floor and she gets out. Mik smiles. Likes her. She’s a challenge. The doors close and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- re-open on the 8th floor. Mike crosses the busy bullpe Howard’s closed office. INT. TNT DIVISION —- HOWARD’S OFFICE - CONTINUOUS

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (knocking as he enters) Hey Captain, they said you wanted to see me.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN HOWARD
dialogues.text: Close the door. Mike sees Howard isn’t alone. There’s someone else with h FBI SPECIAL AGENT DAN KESSLER, 50’s. Mike closes the door

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN HOWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mike, this is Agent Dan Kessler with the FBI Miami field office.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (sitting down) So is this a good meeting or a bad meeting?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT KESSLER
dialogues.text: Aleksander Luga escaped from Burrel Prison in Albania.  17. Mike reacts. He knows the name well. AGENT KESSLER (CONT’D) Needless to say, his capture has become top priority for both the bureau and Interpol.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I’m sure not everyone is being told in person.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN HOWARD
dialogues.text: Mike, the FBI has reason to believe Luga’s on his way to Miami right now.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: To do what?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT KESSLER
dialogues.text: To kill you. For a second that hangs there -- but Mike is hardly rattl

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: That it? Bad guys try to kill me every day.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT KESSLER
dialogues.text: I wouldn't be here if I didn’t think I was saving your life. We've got intel that his people back in Albania have been running searches on you. They have your social security number, your home address...

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Luga’s not a fool. He’s not gonna come all this way, risk all the heat, just to kill me.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT KESSLER
dialogues.text: (deadly serious) That’s exactly what he’ll do. You and Marcus Burnett killed his brother. The Albanians call it “Krvna Osveta”. Means he’s made a blood oath to get revenge against you both. His people have been doing this for centuries. Luga’s on a vendetta and he doesn't give a shit if Miami PD, FBI, Interpol, the Goddamn Marines, are after him. Now for your own safety, you need to be put into protective custody immediately —-  18.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE AGENT KESSLER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (insulted) -- while the FBI tracks down My safety? and apprehends Luga.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: If anyone is gonna apprehend him --

dialogues.speaker: AGENT KESSLER
dialogues.text: (cutting him off; condescending as hell) It’s gonna be the FBI. We know all about how you operate, Lowery. Shoot first, can’t ask a question ‘cause the suspect’s now dead. Now you’re to stand down like a good boy -- Insulted by “boy”, Mike stands up -- towering over Kessle

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Boy, who you calling boy?

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN HOWARD
dialogues.text: (rising; before things get out of hand) Thank you, Agent Kessler. I appreciate you bringing this to our attention. A beat, then Kessler, staring back at Mike, turns to Howa then leaves. The second the door closes behind him:

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Can you believe that shit, Captain?

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN HOWARD
dialogues.text: I absolutely do... That’s why you're going into protective custody immediately.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: What? You gotta be kidding --

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN HOWARD
dialogues.text: This guy broke out of a maximum security prison. I’m not taking any chances.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: There’s no way I’m sitting on my ass alone in some Motel 6 while there’s a target on my back.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN HOWARD
dialogues.text: First of all... it’s a Red Roof Inn and secondly, yes you are. Now go pack yourself a bag.  19. OFF MIKE -- hating this:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fleet of POLICE CRUISERS roar past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cop cars screech to a stop in front. MIAMI-DADE PD OFFICERS rush the house. Knock until Theresa answers.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Is your husband home, ma’am?

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: He’s at work. What’s this about? The Burnett kids file up behind their mom, curious.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: I need you and your family to come with us right now.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Why, what’s happened?

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Everything's fine. I’1ll explain on the way. We just need to make sure you and your family are safe.

dialogues.speaker: A PERSONALIZED LICENCE PLATE.
dialogues.text: Reads “STR8 PMPN.” We’re now:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fire red CAMARO 228 is parked across from a small house

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus surveils the house of a client, MRS. WALLACE. Thro NIGHT-VISION BINOCULARS, Marcus glimpses TOM WALLACE in t kitchen, washing the dishes. Marcus readies a PARABOLIC MIC, unfolding a satellite dis He slips in the earpiece to hear:

dialogues.speaker: MRS. WALLACE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Oh, and can you remind me we need to get the dog’s dewclaw trimmed? He turns down the volume.  20.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. WALLACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jesus, Tom. Why are you putting those pans in the dishwasher? Are you trying to strip the Teflon? Marcus grimaces, muttering to himself.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Don’t let her punk you like that! He sees the Wallaces arguing. Marcus just stares ahead, a faraway look in his eyes. Suddenly -- THREE BLACK SUBURBA WITH TINTED WINDOWS ROAR UP TO THE CAMARO. CAGE HIM IN. Marcus sits up. Who are these guys? Off which:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside Miami, beside a highway, across from an empty fie Sun setting, Cam’s Challenger drives up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walking up with Cam, Mike wraps up a call on his cell.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Crawford. Lowery. Hit me back as soon as you get this.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Thought Howard said no calls.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I’m not gonna sit on my hands. I gotta find this guy before he finds me.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: So this Luga...you and Burnett killed his brother? (Mike nods) And now he wants to kill you. (Mike says nothing) Happens a lot with you, doesn’t it? They round a corner. Cam leads Mike to his room, explaini CAM (CONT’D) Alright, you're in room 124. Daltrey and Sanchez have set up a surveillance room across the hall. Captain’s orders: you are not to leave the room under any circumstances. You need something: food, toothbrush, Q-tip, dial 125. Otherwise, try to relax.  21. On “relax”, Cam unlocks room 124 and the door opens into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Mike is met by MARCUS -- sitting on the edge of the bed, flipping through channels in a pair of SKINNY JEANS.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: What’s he doing here?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: What am I doin’ here? No one said anythin’ about you bein’ here.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Captain’s orders --

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Well, he can un-order it.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Luga wants to kill the both of you.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Which is why I need to get as far away from this man as possible!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: You need to be away from me?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: You're like a magnet for all things life-threatening.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Here we go. (to Cam) Call down to the desk and get me another room.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Can’t do it.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: This is not gonna work.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: This is the only secure room in the hotel. We got it wired for sound and video. We don’t have enough men to watch and protect two rooms, so what can I tell ya? You’re roommates. Cam steps out. Mike and Marcus lock eyes. Silence.  22.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the hall. Daltrey and Sanchez watch the Mike and Marcus reunion on a closed circuit feed. Daltrey packs a of dip -- SNAP, SNAP, SNAP. Cam enters. Joins them at the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: SANCHEZ
dialogues.text: Five bucks says Lowery swings first.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME MIKE AND MARCUS
dialogues.text: Mike notices the mess Marcus has already made in the tiny room: fast food wrappers on the floor; used napkins on th desk; clothes everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Nice to see you’ve learned how to clean up after yourself.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Don’t start up with me. This is a bad situation for both of us.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: So why don’t you -- Mike pauses, fully registering Marcus in his skin-tight skinny jeans for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the hell are you wearing?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: What? These are my threads.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Look at you. You can barely move.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: They fit just fine.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: They're painted on!

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: You're just jealous cause you're not the coolest looking --

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: How the hell am I supposed to take you seriously in those?  23.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: What do I care if you take me seriously or not. That’s the beauty of not having to work with you anymore.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: So why don’t you just walk out? Not like you haven’t done that before.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Oh so that’s how it’s gonna be, huh?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Wasn’t my call, remember?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Yeah, and I know how much that bothers you.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: What’s that supposed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: It’s the Mike Lowery Show and we're all just guest stars.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Is it possible for you to not talk out of your ass?

dialogues.speaker: DALTREY
dialogues.text: My folks used to fight the exact same way.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME MIKE AND MARCUS
dialogues.text: getting loud and tense.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I warned you not to screw around with these Albanians! You know what a blood oath means to these mother- fuckers!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: So I should have just let Luga and his family traffic coke, H and molly all throughout Central Florida?  24.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Luga’s brother could’ve been taken down a whole other way, but no. You had to go all Magnum Force on ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Magnum Force?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: You were a cop. That’s supposed to mean something.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I was a cop. But you were a fucking crazy cop.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Just admit it: you left ‘cause you were scared.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Hell yeah, I was scared! And the fact that I’m locked up here with you ‘cause there’s some super villain tryin’ to kill us proves me right!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FIGURE walks up to Mike and Marcus’ room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seeing the body approach the door:

dialogues.speaker: SANCHEZ
dialogues.text: Heads up, we got movement.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: You know what you need? You need a life coach. ‘Cause sooner or later you were gonna get yourself killed and me along with you!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: If you hated me so much, why’d it take you so long to quit?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Question I ask myself every single day.  25.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The figure knocks on Mike and Marcus’ door.

dialogues.speaker: FIGURE
dialogues.text: Hotel secur -- Doors on either side of him swing open and SEVERAL GUNS a leveled out at the man -- who we now see is a RED ROOF IN EMPLOYEE, scared shitless.

dialogues.speaker: RED ROOF EMPLOYEE
dialogues.text: «..So yeah, if you can keep it down... or not... whatever. (backing away Have a nice night. “Hit the Roof.” He moves down the hall as if there was a motor on his ass A beat later, both room doors are slammed shut -- and Mik and Marcus show the other their backs, tenser than ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cam collapses back in his chair, exhaling:

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: This is gonna be a long assignment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hours have passed. Night has fallen.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME MIKE AND MARCUS
dialogues.text: both in bed -- but only Mike is awake. Can’t sleep. You couldn’t either -- if you heard how LOUDLY Marcus is SNOR

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: You gotta be kidding me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blinding sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike plays chess on his iPad. A cockroach skitters across floor. Marcus sees it. JUMPS.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Oh shit!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: What?  26.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Did you see that? Mike looks up. Doesn't see the cockroach. A SECOND COCKRO then appears. Bigger too. Marcus’s eyes go wide.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh shit! Fuck me!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Would you keep your voice down.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: That’s a fucking armadillo! The second cockroach catches up to the first. Starts EATI it in front of Marcus. (Yes, they do that.)

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Holy shit. It’s eatin’ the mother- fucka! I gotta get the fuck out of here.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: We can’t go anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Not only do they put us together, we got the Goddamn -- Marcus stops, overcome with an intense scratching fit.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why the fuck am I itching?!? What the hell are they doin’ to me in here!?! Mike shakes his head. Give me a break. Off which:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanchez and Daltrey are growing bored watching Mike and Marcus on the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: DALTREY
dialogues.text: Craziest place you’ve ever had sex.

dialogues.speaker: SANCHEZ
dialogues.text: Probably the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: DALTREY
dialogues.text: Bathroom’s not so crazy.

dialogues.speaker: SANCHEZ
dialogues.text: It was in a church. (off Daltrey’s look) Preacher’s daughter.  27. Cam comes in with take-out. Hands out lunch.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: What'd I miss?

dialogues.speaker: ON THE SCREEN
dialogues.text: Mike, on “his side” of the room, kicks Marcus’s trash bac onto “Marcus's side”.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (ON THE SCREEN)
dialogues.text: Would you please clean up after yourself! Mike swings open the door to the bathroom. Instantly reco

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (ON THE SCREEN)
dialogues.text: Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (ON THE SCREEN)
dialogues.text: Yeah, that’s my bad. Cam rolls his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In shadow, a Ford Flex waits, three ALBANIAN GUNMEN in fr The leader, VIKTOR, looks at the cargo ship arriving. Moments later, Luga emerges from the ship.

dialogues.speaker: VIKTOR
dialogues.text: Welcome, Mr. Luga. I’m Viktor. Mr. Hess sent us. We’re to take --

dialogues.speaker: LUGA
dialogues.text: Give me your phone. Viktor’s caught off guard by the request. Luga just stare him down, eyes clarifying “give me your fucking phone.” Viktor doesn’t know what to do, but he knows better than piss someone like Luga off. Wisely hands it over. Luga steps away. Pulls a paper with a number on it. Dials But we stay with Viktor and his men, watching Luga. They trade looks. What the hell is going on? A beat later, Lug returns. Now wants something else.

dialogues.speaker: LUGA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Give me a gun. Viktor trades confused glances with his men.

dialogues.speaker: VIKTOR
dialogues.text: Mr. Luga...?  28.

dialogues.speaker: LUGA
dialogues.text: I said give me a gun now. Luga locks his eyes into Viktor again. No, he’s not fucki around. Viktor is stuck. He hands Luga a Glock. But it’s not enough.

dialogues.speaker: LUGA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You have more? (half-nod from Viktor) Get in the car. Luga moves past them, to the Ford Flex. Viktor turns back his men, who shrug. Who the hell is leading who here? The trio hop into the car. It drives off, sky GRUMBLING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sheet of rain POURS down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Marcus have now been sharing the same small spac for over 24 hours and it shows. Both look frazzled. On ed Mike’s phone buzzes.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Lowery. Marcus looks over, curious as Mike talks -- sotto:

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yeah... yeah, no, I hear you. Well, get back to me if you do. He hangs up. A beat -- then:

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: That about Luga? (Mike says nothing) You got any leads?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: ...Yeah. Few.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: (in the silence) Any you wanna let me in on...?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Sorry, that’s police business. But if someone loses a cat, I'll get you their number.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I’m not a pet detective, Mike.  29.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Right. You're just a private dick.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: At least I keep it private. Everyone knows you’re a dick. Mike gets up into Marcus’s face, tension ESCALATING.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: You know after two days, I’ve had just about enough of your bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: My bullshit?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: That’s right, your bullshit. Don’t forget for one moment: out of the two of us, I’m the only one who is still a cop, so I’m ordering you to sit your ass down and shut up.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: (watching this) Uh-oh. Code red, code-red.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: After all this time, you still think you're the boss of me.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I should do now what I should’ve done a year ago.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Yeah, and what’s that Donald Chump?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Knock you flat on your ass.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: (rolling up his sleeves) Take your best shot, Lowery. A beat -- then they both LUNGE AT EACH OTHER!

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Oh fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLAMMING into walls, THRASHING about the room, CRASHING i the bathroom -- the shower -- SHATTERING mirrors -- both intense and funny at the same time -- like two brothers WRESTLING -- taunting each other in between blows:

dialogues.speaker: MIKE MARCUS
dialogues.text: C’mon, mother-fucker, you That the best you got? No fight like a bitch! wonder you like shooting people -- ‘cause you can’t punch for shit! Finally the door BURSTS OPEN. TNT RUSHES IN. Pries them o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sedan pulls up. It’s Howard. He hurries inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard steps in. Surveys Mike and Marcus, separated and battered, clothes ripped, TNT standing watch over them.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN HOWARD
dialogues.text: What is this, UFC fight night?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Captain --

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This ain’t gonna work, Cap’n. This ain’t gonna work, Cap’ CAPTAIN HOWARD (CONT’D) Ha. Do I know you or what? (to TNT) Kids. Out. Cam, Daltrey and Sanchez file out. When they’re gone:

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN HOWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jesus. Look at the two of you. Were you guys born assholes or did you have to audit a class?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Captain, I appreciate you looking out for us, but how long do you expect us to stay in this room together?

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN HOWARD
dialogues.text: Not a minute longer, Marcus. That’s why I’m here. I’m letting you go.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: You are?  31.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN HOWARD
dialogues.text: No, idiot. There’s a psycho out there with a vendetta against you guys who will not stop until you're in a box! Off which, we begin an INTERCUT with:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ford Flex drives past, wheels kicking up rainwater.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME HOWARD
dialogues.text: talking to Mike and Marcus, sounding like someone who’s n stranger to a couples therapy session.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN HOWARD
dialogues.text: Look, way I see it, you both have a legit beef with the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A propane truck gets re-fueled. The Ford Flex stops behin it. The TRUCK DRIVER goes back to his seat. Luga blows a hole in his chest. Pulls his corpse onto the pavement. Takes his place behind the wheel. Drives off.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN HOWARD
dialogues.text: Mike, you take too many chances and sooner or later that way of living is gonna kill you or those you care about.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME PROPANE TRUCK
dialogues.text: speeding down the highway, the Ford Flex following.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME RED ROOF INN
dialogues.text: CAPTAIN HOWARD (CONT’D) And Marcus, a partner needs to depend on you and you weren’t there for Mike when he needed you most.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor and his men are scared shitless. Viktor is on his phone, talking to Bardha (Hess’s #2).

dialogues.speaker: VIKTOR
dialogues.text: He’s out of his fucking mind!

dialogues.speaker: BARDHA
dialogues.text: I don’t give a shit. He’s your responsibility.

dialogues.speaker: VIKTOR
dialogues.text: You don’t understand. He just took my gun and is leading us somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: BARDHA
dialogues.text: He took your gun or you gave it to him? Viktor doesn’t respond.

dialogues.speaker: BARDHA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Just know: something happens to him, something will happen to you, understand!?! (Viktor does) Now get him and bring him here.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN HOWARD
dialogues.text: But you got too many years together just to throw friendship away because neither of you has the balls to say sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The propane truck rockets forward. In the distance, we ma out the Red Roof Inn.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN HOWARD
dialogues.text: So we’re gonna put this bullshit to a stop. Right here, right now, you’re gonna apologize to each other.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Not gonna happen.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Hell no!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The propane truck hops a curb, SPEEDING the truck toward:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EMPLOYEES and GUESTS look up as HEADLIGHT BEAMS BLAST THE  33. Luga ROARS the propane truck STRAIGHT THROUGH THE FRONT ENTRANCE, EXPLODING GLASS, METAL AND WOOD. Occupants DIVE as the truck BARRELS past and OBLITERATES front desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike, Marcus and Howard react to the crash.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN HOWARD
dialogues.text: What the hell was that?

dialogues.speaker: RESUME LOBBY
dialogues.text: Luga hops out of the truck, stepping into a puddle of PRO POURING out of ruptured tanks, frayed electrical wires swinging like vines overhead, sending up SPARKS. People SCATTER to escape the propane truck, now turned in ticking TIME BOMB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOTEL WORKERS get people to clear out the building fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike draws his gun and looks out the window. Sees nothing

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Mike -- ? The door swings open. Cam, Daltrey and Sanchez rush in.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: We gotta move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GUESTS RUSH OUT. Luga goes to the Ford Flex. Viktor and h men are still panicking that he crashed a truck into a ho

dialogues.speaker: GUNMAN
dialogues.text: (to Viktor) What the fuck do we do? Luga pops open the trunk. Guns inside. He grabs an H&K machine gun. Viktor gets out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: VIKTOR
dialogues.text: Luga, get back in the car now. But Luga isn’t listening, cocking his gun trigger, orderi

dialogues.speaker: LUGA
dialogues.text: Get your fucking guns out!  34. Luga steps away from the car -- toward the hotel. Viktor at a loss. This maniac is gonna get himself killed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike, Marcus, Howard, and the TNT crew join the remaining hotel employees heading toward the exits where --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Luga is waiting to take them out, machine gun leveled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike, Marcus, Howard and the rest of the cops are about t reach the door -- lambs to the slaughter -- -- when Mike STOPS, seeing COMMOTION outside, people SCREAMING when they see Luga: “HE’S GOT A GUN!”

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Whoa, hold up, hold up!

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: What? But before Mike can say --

dialogues.speaker: RESUME LOBBY
dialogues.text: a spark from a downed electrical cable strikes the propan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ceiling RAINS DOWN. Mike, Marcus and the cops HIT THE FLO pieces of wall CRUMBLING around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor looks up from behind his car. Sees Luga entering t hotel. Shit! He turns back to his men in the car:

dialogues.speaker: VIKTOR
dialogues.text: Get out here now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EMERGENCY LIGHTS FLICKER. Mike, Marcus, Howard and the TN cops are still on the floor, heads spinning, ears ringing Mike lifts his face up from the carpet, fighting to re-fo eyes soon adjusting to see:  35. LUGA -- machine gun in hand. Mike’s JOLTED ALERT.

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE UP
dialogues.text: Luga takes aim. But Mike gets to his feet, SHOOTING, caus Luga to DUCK BACK. Marcus quickly jumps up too. Pulls up Howard. Cam, Daltre and Sanchez follow. Luga swings back around, SPRAYING SHOTS, but the cops qui ESCAPE the corridor, BOMBING into nearby doors -- Mike, Marcus and Howard in one that leads to a ROOM; Cam, Daltr and Sanchez in another that leads to an EMERGENCY EXIT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike, Marcus and Howard collapse inside, Howard quickly shutting the door and getting on his phone.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN HOWARD
dialogues.text: 10-24. Shooting at the Red Roof Inn, Highway 87. All patrols respond! A BARRAGE OF GUNFIRE TAKES OUT THE WINDOWS! Mike, Marcus Howard DROP as rounds whiz overhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Backing Luga up, Viktor and his men unleash multiple roun at the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Mike, give me a gun!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I only got the one.

dialogues.speaker: TO ONLY HAVE ONE GUN
dialogues.text: Mike twists to the window. Starts firing out.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We can’t stay here, Mike! But Mike keeps firing, not listening as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Luga appears outside the room. FIRES into the wall.  36.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME MIKE AND MARCUS
dialogues.text: Bullets SHOOTING THROUGH THE WALL, Mike joins Marcus and Howard RACING to a rear door, leading to the adjoining ro Marcus BARRELS into the door, BUSTING into the adjoining as Luga steps inside, still shooting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus and Howard crash to the floor. Mike fires back out Luga, buying Marcus time to help Howard get to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: C’mon Captain, you gotta get up. But Howard doesn’t move -- Marcus soon realizing that his clothes are stained with blood -- HOWARD'S BLOOD. He looks down. Howard's SHOT, bleeding BAD. Marcus looks at Mike, still trading shots with Luga.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mike! Mike turns back. Sees Howard -- trying to talk, but CAN'T

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cam kicks down a back door, firing out at Viktor and the gunmen, Daltrey and Sanchez backing him up, the three soo sprinting over to a parked Buick and ducking down behind

dialogues.speaker: RESUME MIKE
dialogues.text: still firing shots at Luga in the OTHER ROOM while Marcus cradles Howard, fading fast. Luga whips back around to ta aim at Mike, but he fires first -- bullet SHATTERING Luga weapon as he retreats back.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Marcus, stay with him! Mike CHARGES after Luga. Marcus takes Howard's hand.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: It’s gonna be okay, Captain. You're gonna be alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TNT continues to trade fire with the gunmen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike enters, gun first. No Luga. But he sees a nearby doo ajar. He rushes up, kicks the door.  37.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike moves inside. Still no sign of Luga -- but the windo OPEN. He rushes over. Looks out. Nothing. Then: A REFLECTION. Mike whips around to find Luga CHARGING HIM the two CRASHING into each other, FLYING out the window -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- SLAMMING hard to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police cruisers roar toward the hotel, sirens wailing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cam, Daltrey and Sanchez fire back at the gunmen, who jum back into their Ford Flex, FIRING UP the engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus cradles Howard, slipping...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Luga trade vicious blows on the ground. Luga rea behind his back. Draws a SIX INCH STILETTO. He THRUSTS it down -- but Mike grabs his wrist. Luga pres down HARDER. Mike BITES Luga’s hand. Kicks him off. Then -- HEADLIGHT BEAMS hit Mike. He looks up to see the FLEX SCREAMING UP. Mike quickly ROLLS out of the way, the SUV just missing h screeching to a sudden stop, on its way to picking up Lug POLICE CRUISERS appear in the distance, coming up fast. The Ford Flex doors open, Viktor screaming at Luga to:

dialogues.speaker: GET IN THE FUCKING CAR
dialogues.text: But Luga refuses to go, a man POSSESSED as he grabs a gun from one of Viktor’s men and hurries around to the other of the SUV -- FIRING at Mike, who DIVES behind a parked c Luga keeping his finger firmly pressed on the trigger, ro ripping open the fuel tank. Mike sees the car is about to blow and he quickly RUNS OF Luga continues to shoot until -- -- BOOOOM! -- the car ERUPTS. Goes AIRBORNE. Mike DIVES.  38. The car comes CRASHING down, stopping short of crushing M when it lands atop another car hood, right beside him. Luga -- CLICK! -- runs out of bullets. Cam, Daltrey and Sanchez run up, firing in his direction. Luga turns. Sees the cruisers coming. Then whips around, searching again for Mike -- but he can’t see him through rain, smoke and fire. FUCK! He missed his shot. He gets back in the Ford Flex. It PEELS AWAY. Covered in soot, Mike watches Luga disappear. Then as police cruisers pull up, everything starts SLOWIN DOWN, SOUND DROPPING OUT, MUSIC TAKING OVER as WE GO TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PARAMEDICS rush inside, over to Howard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard is loaded into the ambulance. Mike, Marcus and TNT watch and pray as the ambulance pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ambulance roars away, bubble lights blurred by rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cops hold a vigil for Howard in the lobby. Sanchez prays the chapel. Daltrey and Cam comfort Howard’s family. Mike Marcus are in one of the exam rooms, giving blood, silent

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard goes under the knife. He has vital signs, but they very faint. Don’t know if he’1l live or die as we GO TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To ESTABLISH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hess watches TV news coverage of the Red Roof Inn shootin livid, when Bardha appears in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: BARDHA
dialogues.text: He’s here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hess and Bardha find Luga walking calmly inside.  39.

dialogues.speaker: HESS
dialogues.text: (in Albanian; subtitled) Do you know what you did? You’re all over the fucking news! Luga says nothing. Just lets Hess bluster.

dialogues.speaker: HESS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Every law enforcement agent in Florida is looking for you now.

dialogues.speaker: LUGA
dialogues.text: You think I care about your police? Back home, they’re the criminals.

dialogues.speaker: HESS
dialogues.text: You’re not home. We have a way of doing things here. And I’m not gonna let you further jeopardize everything I’ve worked toward --

dialogues.speaker: LUGA
dialogues.text: You hide. You fear the police when they should fear you.

dialogues.speaker: HESS
dialogues.text: (not backing down) Forager’s here in two days. You’re not leaving until then. Luga sees he’s surrounded by Hess’s GUNMEN. Trapped. He then turns back to Hess. Says nothing. Just smiles. It unnerving as hell. A chill runs down Hess’s spine but he doesn’t let his anxiety show. Moments later, a metal door SLIDES OPEN. Luga steps insid disappearing down into the basement. Albanians SEAL the door behind him, locking Luga inside.

dialogues.speaker: BARDHA
dialogues.text: Are you sure about him?

dialogues.speaker: HESS
dialogues.text: I’m sure he’s essential. I’m sure if he wasn’t the only one who could do what needed to be done, I’d drown him in the river myself. (turning to Bardha) The three you sent to bring him here. .?

dialogues.speaker: BARDHA
dialogues.text: They didn’t show. Luga came alone. Viktor and them are probably running. Scared for their lives.  40.

dialogues.speaker: HESS
dialogues.text: They should be. Find them -- and kill them. Bardha nods. Turns and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT KESSLER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What part of what I’m telling you are you not clear about, lieutenant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie squares off against Kessler, passionate and intense Also on hand: MIAMI-DADE P.D. BRASS, including INSPECTOR ROBERT LUTTRELL of Internal Affairs. 40's. Tough, but fai

dialogues.speaker: AGENT KESSLER
dialogues.text: You and your officers are to stand down from this investigation immediately.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: And what part of “I don’t give a shit” are you not clear about, Agent Kessler? That’s one of our own fighting for his life ina hospital bed right now. No way FBI keeps us out of this!

dialogues.speaker: AGENT KESSLER
dialogues.text: Do you even know who you’re dealing with? Before he was an enforcer with the Albanian mafia, Aleksander Luga was in the Special Operations Battalion. One of the best trained units in Europe and part of the elite Commando Regiment. He’s also an experienced pilot, highly skilled in hand-to-hand combat, knife training and light and heavy artillery readiness. Responsible for at least 26 confirmed assassinations, so even if we allowed Miami PD to go after him, you’re not equipped to do so.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: (not backing down) That is total bullshit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike moves with purpose up the corridor. He’s still in la night’s blood-stained clothes.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT KESSLER
dialogues.text: (softening) Look, Lieutenant, I’m sorry about Captain Howard... I am. But this is bigger than you know.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Why? What are you talking about? Kessler pauses. Doesn’t want to give up any details, but silence betrays him.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: Luga didn’t just come here to kill Lowery and Burnett, did he?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT KESSLER
dialogues.text: I can’t tell you that. Not until we can be sure there are no more leaks.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Leaks?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT KESSLER
dialogues.text: Luga found out where you were keeping Lowery and Burnett. That didn’t come from us. What you should be focusing on now is finding another safe place for them to wait this out.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: Because that worked so well the first time? Or is it cause you think setting up one of ours as bait is a good way to flush out your fugitive?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT KESSLER
dialogues.text: Conspiracy theories aside, Luga is an FBI matter -- which means Miami PD will stand down. All evidence relating to last night is under our jurisdiction.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Agent Kessler, with all due respect, the shooting at the Red Roof Inn involved our officers, not yours. Miami PD Internal Affairs has a responsibility to investigate and every right to look at any evidence you have. Kessler pauses. He’s right. Can’t shut him out.  42.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT KESSLER
dialogues.text: Alright... I’1l allow access only to Internal Affairs, but our cooperation ends there, you understand? Luttrell nods. Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike reaches the situation room just as the door opens an Kessler moves out past him. Ellie sees Mike and walks up.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Let me guess: stand down and shut up?

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: I know how you feel, Mike. No one wants to get this asshole more than me, but we have to let the Feds take the lead. But Mike doesn’t buy that, cutting past her, leaving.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mike!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike moves with purpose. Down the hall from him is Cam wi the TNT team. He sees Mike coming. Offers condolences.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Mike, about Captain Howard, I just wanted to say -- But he never gets it out, Mike blowing by him. Shut out, watches his partner disappear around a corner as we GO TO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five Miami-Dade PD cars are parked in front, keeping watc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police looking on: Burnetts dump bags and suitcases, pack for an extended trip. Marcus coordinates from a balcony.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Alright Burnetts, you’re just here to take what you need and get out. You’re leavin’ in ten minutes. Jesus, Megan, how many suitcases you plan on bringin’? You’re just goin’ on a trip, you’re not movin’ out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do I know that? No one’s telling me where we’re going or for how long.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: That’s ‘cause you don’t need to know. It’s not safe. I’m tryin’ to protect you.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Then let me bring all my clothes with me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike’s Ferrari rolls up. He regards the house. Been since he’s been here. A beat and he walks to the door. Gives a nod to the cops manning the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Responding to Mike’s knock, Theresa opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: (surprised) Mike.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Hey, Theresa, great to see you. They hug. Unlike her husband, Theresa missed seeing

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Great to see you. Even under the circumstances... How’s Captain Howard?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Hard to say. Touch and go.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: We're praying for him. Marcus's kids see Mike. Head over. Thrilled.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES /QUINCY
dialogues.text: Hey, Uncle Mike!/Yo, Uncle Mike, what's up? 43. a while uniform him. Seeing them, Mike lights up. He missed them. They slap ha

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Oh my God, you boys got HUGE! Megan, damn, you’re a beauty.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What are you doin’ here, Mike? Mike looks up to see Marcus, on the balcony above.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: (behave) Marcus.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Uncle Mike, has my dad told you the good news?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE MARCUS
dialogues.text: What news? Megan, zip it!

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: (as Marcus protests: ) I’m pregnant! Mike’s jaw drops.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: wow! (to Marcus)

dialogues.speaker: HEY
dialogues.text: (to Megan)

dialogues.speaker: YES
dialogues.text: (they hug)

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Thank you!

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Mike. Downstairs. Now. INT. BURNETT HOUSE - “RUMPUS ROOM” - MOMENTS LATER Marcus leads Mike downstairs. Mike looks around the “offi

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Wow. The nerve center.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: What are you doin’ here, Mike? I thought you wanted nothin’ to do with me.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: You still tight with Coleman at the FBI Miami office?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: ...-He owes me a few favors. Why?  45.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Feds are shutting Miami PD out of the Luga investigation. I need access to the Feds’ evidence file on the shooting last night.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: So you came here to use me.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Regardless of what’s going on with you and me, I owe it to Howard to go after Luga. Not to mention that as long as he’s out there, neither one of us is safe. No matter how far you send your family away. Marcus considers him, then:

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: You don’t have to convince me. I wanna find him just as badly as you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike waits for Marcus to say his goodbyes.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Alright, y’all say goodbye. Daddy's gotta go to work. The Burnetts flock in -- but quickly bypass their dad and directly to Mike, hugging him with love.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES /QUINCY/MEGAN
dialogues.text: Bye, Uncle Mike!/We love you!/Please see us again! Mike beams, hugging them back -- while Marcus steams.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Yeah, keep on showin’ him the love. It’s not like Uncle Mike’s the reason you-all goin’ into hidin’. Marcus sees Theresa, coming down the hall. He crosses up her. They hug. A private husband and wife moment.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: I’m scared, Marcus.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Don’t be, baby. These cops are gonna make sure nothing happens to you or the kids. Everything’s gonna be alright. I swear.  46. Mike watches the couple, close. We catch a flicker of reg on his face -- then Marcus walks out with him.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: My car’s over here.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Oh no, no, this ain’t like old times. I’m not riding shotgun in Bruce Wayne’s car. We doin’ this, we're taking my ride this time. Marcus leads Mike over to his red-hot Camaro.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Whoa... (reading the license plate) Straight Pimpin’. Huh. They couldn’t fit mid-life crisis on there? Marcus digs into the pocket of his skinny jeans.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sure you can even get the keys out?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I can get the keys out! Marcus struggles. Clearly he can’t. Mike can’t help but smile as Marcus, with some difficulty finally gets his hand out of his pocket, pulling out his -- along with his wallet and phone -- which go FLYING.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Not a word.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: No problem, grandpa. Marcus pauses, steaming -- then picks up his stuff and ge in the car without another word to Mike. The two drive of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BLUR of stock cars ZIP around a race track. Marcus sits with COLEMAN, an old friend and seasoned FBI agent.

dialogues.speaker: COLEMAN
dialogues.text: The office already got an e-mail about this, warning everyone not to cooperate with Miami PD.  47.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Good thing I’m not Miami PD anymore.

dialogues.speaker: COLEMAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, but your crazy-ass partner still is.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Lowery ain't my partner no more. This is for me and Captain Howard. Coleman debates, then:

dialogues.speaker: COLEMAN
dialogues.text: Alright...but this stays between us. We ID’d one of the shooters with Luga from the hotel surveillance footage. His name’s Viktor Gojahki. He’s tied into the Albanian mob, but he’s pissing in the wind. No one knows where he is. And if we can’t find him, good luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike stands in front of the Camaro. A group of hot-lookin SPEEDWAY GIRLS walk past. Give Mike the eye.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Yup, I can make any car look good. Marcus crosses up.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I got a name. Marcus gets in the car as Mike’s phone buzzes.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Lowery.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Just wanted to make sure I made myself clear earlier.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: What, about not wanting to date me? Yeah, but I didn’t really take that too seriously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. MIAMI-DADE P.D. HEADQUARTERS - ELLIE’S OFFICE - SAME

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: About Luga. You’re not going after him, correct?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Absolutely not.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: ‘Cause you need to stay away from this case. Cam’s with you, right?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Of course. We’re attached at the hip. I love that kid.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: Good. I want someone watching your back. After last night, you need to low. I’1l check in with you guys later.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Always love you checking me out, Lt. Ellie hangs up. Mike knows he has no choice but to call C

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cam POUNDS a punching bag, then answers his ringing phone

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: What’s up, Mike?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Marcus ride in front, Cam sits in the back.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: (after a beat of silence) So, Mike... you gonna tell me where we're going or what?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I’1l tell you when we get there.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: I know you don’t think so, but I can probably contribute to whatever it is you’re not supposed to be doing. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: CAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (off Mike’s silence, Cam leans forward) Come on, I saw your eyes at HQ and after your couples therapy session at the inn, there’s only one reason you'd be sharing a car with Burnett. You're going after Luga and you're worried if Ellie sees me without my partner, she’ll stop you. Mike won't admit he’s right. Marcus is impressed.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Gotta say, Mike, your boy’s quick.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: He’s not my boy. He’s a pain in the ass.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Hey Mike, just because I don’t do things exactly the way you do --

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: You don’t know how to do things, that’s the problem.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: You know, I don’t know what it is, but there’s something very familiar about this conversation.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Don't start in, Marcus.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Cam, let me ask you something: has Mike ever canceled SWAT on you right before you’re about to go in on a bust?

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Shit, yeah. He did it twice in the same month.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Alright, what you gotta do next time is call ahead and let them know --

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: What are you, his mentor now?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: That's right. Professor Marcus X.  50.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Let me ask you something, Marcus.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Shoot, my brother.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: When you guys were on a stakeout and you had to have something to eat --

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: (knows exactly where this is going) And he won’t let you have food in his car. Man, bullshit to that! Cam and Marcus laugh. Mike doesn’t.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Man, you're alright, Marcus.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Thanks, Cam. I think you’re cool too.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: That definitely means a lot froma grown ass man in skinny jeans. Before Marcus can strike back:

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Yeah, I was gonna ask, what is up with those pants anyway? They help with posture or...?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: What the fuck, you're starting in on me, too!?!

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, but Mike does have a point.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I don’t believe this shit.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Yeah, it’s tough when you think someone’s got your back and then they don’t.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Mike, come on, that isn’t fair --  51.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Shut up, Cam.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Yeah, shut up, Cam. Cam sits back, giving up.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Man, you guys deserve each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A violent Miami neighborhood. The Camaro drives through.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Okay. According to Payton in gang intel, Gojahki’s mother lives there. #11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Camaro stops across the street from the #11 house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peering out the window at Viktor’s mom’s house:

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: You sure this is gonna work?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: These Albanians are nothing if not tight with their families. Marcus, you got any surveillance equipment?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I’m a PI, Mike. What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trunk pops open. Inside: various audio and visual surveillance equipment -- along with personal defense weapons, including a TASER GUN. Marcus grabs a phone hacking device called a GYPSY WIRE w Cam picks up a camcorder. Presses play. His jaw drops whe

dialogues.speaker: A VERY SHAKY SEX TAPE
dialogues.text: between Marcus and Theresa plays.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (ON THE TAPE)
dialogues.text: Come on, Marcus, forget the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me baby, we’re gonna love having this when we’re older. 52. Husband and wife go at it as Marcus’s eyes light up. Mike looks over the screen.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Dude, two words “tri-pod”

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Give it back!

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: I think I see the tri-pod. Red, Marcus grabs the camera from Cam. Shuts it off.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Just say the word and I can give you a few pointers. Marcus tosses the camera back into the trunk. Replaces it with a pair of SPIKED CLIMBING SHOES.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who are you, Paul Bunyon?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: How else do you think I’m gettin’ up on that pole? Marcus slips on the shoes:

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: So you call up the mom, tell her that her son’s been shot. She tries calling Viktor, but Marcus cuts the line before the call is placed.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Mom has no choice but to see if he’s alive for herself. She gets in her car --

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: And takes us right to him. Marcus rises. Grabs the gypsy wire. Puts his “game face”

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Okay. Let’s do this. Marcus shuts the trunk and walks off toward the TELEPHONE POLE, spikes digging into the pavement with each step.  53. INT. VIKTOR’S MOM’S HOUSE - MOMENTS LATER An Albanian soap plays on a TV with rabbit ears. MRS. GOJAHKI adjusts her recliner. She’s old and mean as fuck. In the window behind her, we can just make out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Marcus struggling to climb the telephone pole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same seats as before: Mike, up front. Cam in the back.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: You really hate having a partner don’t you, Mike? Mike says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: CAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Marcus, me. If it was up to you, you'd just do everything yourself.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Occasionally I need someone to get me coffee.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: You read my jacket before we were partnered up. You know what I can do. What I bring to the game.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Headache. Problem with you is you have no idea what it takes to be a real cop. You got no field experience.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: I think the only reason you give me no respect is because I remind you of you -- only you’re a step slower and I’m the up and comer.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Please, if you reminded me of me, I'd kick my own ass. Now shut up. You may learn something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweat POURING, Marcus reaches the phone box. He pops it o and connects the gypsy wire, tapping into the mom’s line.  54.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: ++. cool. And you’re sure she just has the land line, right? No cell phone. (beat) Thanks, Lisa. I owe you one. He hangs up. Dials a new number. INT. VIKTOR’S MOM’S HOUSE - INTERCUTTING An old-school ROTARY PHONE rings. Viktor’s mom grimaces a answers the call. With a THICK EUROPEAN ACCENT:

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GOJAHKI
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: This is Viktor Gojahki’s mom?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GOJAHKI
dialogues.text: Who this?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I’m the guy who just shot your son! He’s dead. Mike hangs up. Cam looks at him, shameful.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: This is just mean, man.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Mean, but it works. Mrs. Gojahki hangs up, concerned. Is it true? She immedia picks back up the phone. Dials a new number.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME MARCUS
dialogues.text: hearing her dial a new number, but before she can get connected to anyone, he cuts the call.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GOJAHKI
dialogues.text: (hearing nothing on the other end) Hello?... Hello? Nothing. She hangs up. Thinks. Then steps out of frame.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME MARCUS
dialogues.text: climbing down the wooden pole. Gets a splinter along the  55.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Ahh fuck! (then another) Shit. (and a third for good measure) Mother-fucka! He jumps the last few feet and hits the ground, swallowin yell. Then steels himself and gets back in the Camaro. Viktor’s mom exits her house, gets into her own car and drives down off. Marcus follows in pursuit. The plan work

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sun setting, Viktor’s mom’s car passes, followed by Marcu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Built in 1963, the concrete amphitheatre overlooking a ma made basin and the Miami skyline was condemned in 1992. I stands now, completely painted over in graffiti. Viktor’s mom pulls up to the street to the stadium.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
