dialogues.text: Alright, she’s slowing down. Viktor must be hiding out in the stadium. Get in front of her. We’ll cut her off. Marcus, get to her door. Marcus hits the gas. Cuts in front of the mom’s car. She stops short. Mike, Marcus and Cam explode out of the Cama Marcus is the first to reach the mom -- going up to her d

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Ma’‘am, I need you step -- But that’s all he gets out. Viktor’s mom puts a STUN GUN his hand. Shocks him with 50,000 volts. Marcus CONVULSES. CRASHES. Mike and Cam rush over. Viktor mom BOMBS out of the car, SWINGING her purse in Mike’s fa over and over, kicking the crap out of him.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Do something!

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: I have no field experience, remember. Mike catches the purse. Engages in a TUG OF WAR with the  56.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Jesus, she’s got a grip! Cam gets an idea. Rushes off. Viktor’s mom starts SPITTIN and CURSING at Mike. VIKTOR’'S MOM I kill you! I kill you! Marcus staggers to his feet. Grabs the mom from behind. T to yank her back when -- -- TWO PROBES ATTACHED TO TASER WIRES tag her in the ches Cam hits the trigger on Marcus’s TASER GUN. She gets SHOC and FALLS BACKWARD onto Marcus -- the two HITTING THE GRO Marcus breaking her fall. Mike and Cam stand over the pair. Marcus winces.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Next time...you get the door.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: What do we do with her now?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Call in a uniform. Get him to take her back home. OFF MARCUS -- the 75 year old mother SEIZING on top of hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few feet beside Viktor’s Ford Flex, Mike and Cam get gu Ready for war. Mike sees Marcus doing the same.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Whoa, hold up, what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: What’s it look like?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: It looks like you’re gearing up for police business and in case you forgot, you’re not the police anymore.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I wasn’t the police either when my ass was climbing that telephone poll.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: That was different.  57.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Because I wasn’t gonna do that.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: So you were just using me.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Hey, you were the one who didn’t want to be a cop, remember? So stand back, citizen.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Hey, Mike, come on, three sets of guns are better than two.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Depends who’s doing the shooting, and who asked you?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I told you: I’m here for Howard. Not for you. You’re not my boss, my partner or my friend anymore. I’m going in. Marcus cocks his gun and heads off. Mike can’t help but respect his loyalty to Howard. Back to Cam:

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: And you: better follow my lead. Mike heads off after Marcus. Cam follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abandoned for decades, the metal seats now come in two colors: rust and graffiti. Mike, Marcus and Cam move quie inside. There’s no sign of Viktor. The stadium looks EMPT But --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hiding behind columns a few feet ahead, Glocks ready. Whe Mike, Marcus and Cam approach -- they swing around, FIRIN Mike, Marcus and Cam take cover behind seats and concrete pillars, SHOOTING BACK -- GUNFIRE DEAFENING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two black Suburbans ROAR UP. Doors explode open. BARDHA AND A TEAM OF SHOOTERS hop out. Rush the stadium.  58.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME MIKE, MARCUS AND CAM
dialogues.text: still trading rounds with Viktor and his men when --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike, Marcus and Cam whip around. See Bardha and his shoo advancing, FIRING. The trio return shots in both directions -- but they are MANNED -- caught in a CROSSFIRE between Bardha and his te and Viktor and his men.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Fuck, they’re flanking us! Move back! Mike, Marcus and Cam make a DASH up the aisle, making the way up to an UPPER LEVEL to escape the gunfire, taking co behind a PLASTIC TARP hanging down from the roof. But the GUNFIRE CONTINUES. Mike quickly re-loads his gun and throws the plastic asid see what’s going on below -- and he’s thrown! Bardha and his team aren’t pursuing them. They’re ADVANCI on Viktor and his men. Mike seeing: Bardha and his men fire multiple rounds at Viktor and the gunman, riddling Gunman #1 -- then tagging Gunman #2.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (realizing) They’re not here for us. They’re here for them! Viktor fires back at Bardha and his team -- then TAKES OF RUNNING FOR HIS LIFE. Mike gives chase -- following Bardha and his men, racing after Viktor -- who reaches the end of an aisle and -- JUMPS OVER the side of the stadium -- dropping several fe to the pavement below. Bardha and his team run up and FIRE DOWN on him, but Vikt ESCAPES, rushing UNDERNEATH the lowest level of the stadi Mike comes up behind Bardha and his men. Fires. Hits one, he’s wearing KEVLAR. The others return shots. Mike ducks down behind seats, bullets PINGING metal.  59.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor emerges from underneath the stadium and JUMPS into Ford Flex. SLAMS the door. He’s about to turn the key whe Bardha and his team run up. Surround the car. Viktor goes duck down. Too late. The SUV gets COMPLETELY DEMOLISHED WITH BULLETS that RIP through the car and Viktor’s flesh, killing him. Bardha then turns to the Camaro. Fires a shot into a tire Mike gets outside as Bardha and his team ROAR OFF in thei Suburbans. He goes to run into the Camaro to pursue. Stop short when he sees the flat front tire. Shit. IN THE DISTANCE: police sirens WAIL and cruisers approach

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor’s men lie on the cement, dead. Marcus hovers over their bodies, looking like he’s about to hurl.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Hey... you alright? Holding back barf -- but trying to play it off:

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Yeah. You know. Just... acid reflux. He gags. Mike comes up. Immediately pats down one of the bodies, pulling what he can from his pockets.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: What you should be. Taking whatever evidence we can before the Feds do. These guys were our best shot at gettin’ to Luga. Whatever they could tell us, someone made sure we couldn’t find out. We need to figure out what. Marcus and Cam soon join in. Go through pockets. Jackets. Marcus finds a phone, Cam a wallet. But then -- Cam sees something else: a FOLDED PIECE OF PA sticking out of the sock of Gunman #2. Cam pulls it out and unfolds the paper. Written on it: TH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red and blue lights converge on the stadium and we GO TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike, Marcus and Cam give statements to MIAMI PD. Agent Kessler soon arrives, backed by THREE FBI AGENTS.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT KESSLER
dialogues.text: (livid) I hate to repeat myself, Lowery. Now, this is the second time I’ve had to warn you not to interfere with this investigation.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Some investigation. We’re the ones who found the hotel shooters.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT KESSLER
dialogues.text: What are you doing here anyway? You’re a Goddamn civilian.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: (up in his face; pissed) “I'm a Goddamn civilian? I’ma Goddman civilian.” (beat; realizing; backing off) Yeah, that’s right, I’m a Goddamn civilian.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT KESSLER
dialogues.text: (to his agents) I want them searched. Mike, Marcus and Cam protest but the FBI agents with Kess don't give a shit, patting them down, finding Marcus’s gu

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I got a permit for that. -- and a gunman’s phone in Mike’s pocket. Kessler grabs i

dialogues.speaker: AGENT KESSLER
dialogues.text: You got a permit for this? Another agent finds a wallet in Cam’s pocket.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Hey, that’s mine. The agent shows the ID to Kessler.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT KESSLER
dialogues.text: (reading the Albanian name on the card) Enver Biba?  61.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: It’s my porno name. I also go by Hung Frankenstein.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT KESSLER
dialogues.text: Detain them. The Feds quickly slap on cuffs.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: What the fuck, Kessler!?! Mike, Marcus and Cam are pulled over to the FBI sedans.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Agent Kessler! Kessler turns. Sees Luttrell walking up. LUTTRELL (CONT’D) What are you doing to my detectives?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT KESSLER
dialogues.text: What the hell does it look like?

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: A Federal agent detaining Miami PD. You don’t want the headlines or the headache. Trust me. Kessler pauses. He definitely doesn’t. LUTTRELL (CONT’D) Put them in my custody. Let Internal Affairs handle them.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT KESSLER
dialogues.text: Like you've handled them so far?

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: They won’t be a problem anymore. Kessler considers Luttrell. A beat, then warns:

dialogues.speaker: AGENT KESSLER
dialogues.text: They interfere again, I’m gonna arrest them for willful impeding of a Federal Investigation. That clear?

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Crystal. Kessler orders his men to let Mike, Marcus and Cam free. soon as the Feds walk away:  62.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Thanks, man.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Please. I love standing up to those Federal pricks. Mike, I know how bad you want Luga. I do too. But you're bringing down too much heat.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Just tell me what else Kessler knows about Luga.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: (beat, then: ) What I’ve managed to piece together is: the FBI has intercepted a lot of chatter on Albanian organized e- mail communications. References to something called “Forager.” And according to their HUMINT sources, they believe someone inside the country has brought Luga here as talent to pull off some major drug operation.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: We gotta get this guy fast, Mike.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Maybe this will help. Cam reaches down and takes off a shoe.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Your socks? Cam pulls the paper he took off the gunman out of his sho

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Got this off one of Viktor’s boys. Stashed it in my shoe in case we had to give the other evidence up. Marcus is instantly impressed. Mike is too, but isn’t sho it. Marcus picks up on this.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Okay, I’ll say it: “Fuck yeah.” Mike takes the paper. Doesn’t know what to make of it.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Mike, a word. Mike hands the paper back to Cam and walks off with Luttr  63. LUTTRELL (CONT’D) There’s something else. Didn’t want to say in front of the others.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: What’s up?

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: I’ve been looking into who had knowledge that you guys were hiding out at the hotel. Only a handful of people knew and all of them were cops. The leak definitely came from inside Miami PD, maybe even your unit. Somebody’s gone bad. I’m gonna find out who, but in the meantime, don’t trust anyone. Mike considers that, as we GO TO:

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I asked you point blank if you were investigating Luga -- INT. MIAMI-DADE P.D. HEADQUARTERS - ELLIE’S OFFICE - SAME Ellie tears into Mike and Cam.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: -- and you gave me your word that you were standing down.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Did you really expect anything different?

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: Not from Mike Lowery, no. She leans forward.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know you don’t respect me. But you should at least respect that I have a job to do.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: And so do I. This asshole’s come here to kill me and because of that, Captain Howard's fighting for his life. You wanna talk respect? (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How ‘bout the respect you owe your cops instead of the Feds -- or the respect I owe Howard to go after Luga and bring his ass down for what he did? (rising from his seat) And I'd do the same if it was you in the hospital right now instead of him. Ellie looks at Mike. He’s telling the truth but despite h loyalty to Howard, she can’t let him off the hook.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: I would suspend you, but I don’t think that would help. So you -- (to Cam) -- get your toothbrush, your pajamas, whatever you need, cause from this moment on, you’re on Mike watch. Every move he makes you’re gonna tell me about it. And if he screws up, it’s on you too. (back to Mike) This is not gonna end with you dead or in jail. This is for your own good. Tell me you understand that.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: ...I understand.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: Good. Now get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As soon as Ellie’s door is shut:

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I need to know right now: are you gonna be a problem? Cam locks eyes with Mike.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Howard is my Captain too. A beat. Mike nods. The two continue down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daltrey’s with Sanchez, trying to decipher the paper list numbers, letters and symbols. Getting close.

dialogues.speaker: SANCHEZ
dialogues.text: Penis-sized nipple or a nipple- sized penis?  65.

dialogues.speaker: DALTREY
dialogues.text: (beat) Nipple. Mike hurries in with Cam, urgent:

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Where you at with those codes?

dialogues.speaker: DALTREY
dialogues.text: Still working on it.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Alright, here's how it goes: Cam, you pair up with Daltrey. I wanna know what those codes mean. I’m headin’ over to Miami General. Sanchez: how are your gang connections? Any owe you favors?

dialogues.speaker: SANCHEZ
dialogues.text: I got a guy who’s in ABK. Runs a bodega in Miami Gardens.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Reach out to him. Have him slip it to two or three operators in the Albanian community that one of the hotel shooters survived the hit tonight and is listed as a John Doe at the hospital. When word travels up the chain that one of their targets is alive and talkin’ to the cops, the Albanians are gonna send someone to finish the job. I’1l have a heart to heart with him and find out where Luga’s hiding his ass. Call me when y’all have something. Mike steps back out into the hallway. Cam hurries after h

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Dude, what the hell? You’re benching me? I thought we had an understanding. Mike stops.

dialogues.speaker: CAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You need to trust me.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I am. With that list.  66.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: So while I’m picking up your scraps you can go off and do the real cop work?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Look, right now Luga’s out there somewhere. I don’t know what he’s doin’, but I know it’s not good. If I can’t find out on my own, you're gonna have to get something off that list. Either way, it’s not open for debate. Cam considers Mike. The assignment does have importance.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now I gotta go get my decoy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus strips out of his clothes to change into an unflattering hospital gown -- and he’s NOT happy.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: This is some next level embarrassment right here.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: You're the one who said you wanted to be involved.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Well, thanks for tossin’ me a fuckin’ bone. Any dignity I had before today? Gone.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Would you just get in bed and quit complaining?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Hey, as long as I’m the one whose ass is literally exposed here, I’m gonna complain as much as I want. He finally gets the gown on and hops into the bed.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You all good in here, Mike? Mike turns to the door to find an ATTRACTIVE NURSE.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Yeah, Dena. Listen, I can’t thank you enough for hooking this up. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If there’s anything I can do to repay the favor...

dialogues.speaker: DENA
dialogues.text: Anything? Gonna keep you to that. She smiles seductively and slips out.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: (yelling out the room) Gonna need a bed pan in here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daltrey runs the list of codes through a scanner. Pulls t image up on a wall monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over the next SEVERAL HOURS, Cam tries to break down the with a pen, re-arranging letters, words and symbols onto piece of paper as: Daltrey types an algorithm into a computer. Hits ENTER. Immediately all the numbers, letters and symbols start to move around and change order. Eventually -- Daltrey’s algorithm cracks the first cipher.

dialogues.speaker: DALTREY
dialogues.text: Holy shit, I got it. Cam snaps up, alert.

dialogues.speaker: DALTREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The code’s based off the Albanian alphabet. We just need to figure out which numbers correspond to which letters --

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: And then add them to the letters that already exist.

dialogues.speaker: DALTREY
dialogues.text: Exactly. Daltrey types more commands into the computer, cross- referencing letters in the code with the Albanian alphabe

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Hold up. What about the symbols?

dialogues.speaker: DALTREY
dialogues.text: The symbols are nothing. Garbage. Noise to keep us from seeing the real code.  68. Cam jots down a few ALBANIAN WORDS as they appear. Then t into another computer. Translates the Albanian words in t first coded entry into English. Comes up with:

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Morrow Airpark. Daltrey does the same routine for the second code.

dialogues.speaker: DALTREY
dialogues.text: Next code’s an address. 27309 Fleming Avenue. Daltrey enters the address into his computer.

dialogues.speaker: DALTREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s a gas depot.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: And the last code? Daltrey tries to crack it using the same method as the ot two, but can’t.

dialogues.speaker: DALTREY
dialogues.text: ...I don’t know. This cipher’s different from the other two. It’s not based on the same alphabet. Gonna take some time to break. Cam checks his watch. Makes a call.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Okay. Let’s get started on the first two. MUSIC, MOMENTUM -- as we GO TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanchez cuts through a back, graffiti-lined street. Draws phone while covertly making her way up to the back of a neighborhood bodega. Sends a text. The back door cracks o as she arrives. She slips inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanchez sits on a crate. Meets secretly with CARLOS, the bodega’s owner. Young. Confident.

dialogues.speaker: CARLOS
dialogues.text: How many people we talkin’ about?

dialogues.speaker: SANCHEZ
dialogues.text: Two or three. But it can’t get back to us. Think you can handle it for me?  69.

dialogues.speaker: CARLOS
dialogues.text: Have I ever let you down before?

dialogues.speaker: SANCHEZ
dialogues.text: (rising) I owe you one, Carlos.

dialogues.speaker: CARLOS
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) I still owe you for helpin’ my sister out.

dialogues.speaker: SANCHEZ
dialogues.text: Make this happen and we’re even. OFF CARLOS, nodding, no problem -- MUSIC RESUMES -- LAUNC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An aircraft “boneyard” filled with retired military and civilian planes, stripped for parts and gathering rust. Daltrey flashes his badge to the AIRPARK FOREMAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daltrey speeds through SURVEILLANCE FOOTAGE of the airpar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fuel depository for commercial use only. Cam roars up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daltrey stops when he sees TWO ALBANIANS pull up in a familiar-—looking Suburban and disappear inside a MILITAR AIRCRAFT. Fast-forwards until the men re-emerge -- now carrying wit them: a HARRIS FALCON MILITARY RADIO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cam interviews the DEPOT MANAGER.

dialogues.speaker: DEPOT MANAGER
dialogues.text: Yeah, that’s right, about two hours ago. Two foreign guys purchased 12,000 lbs of AV fuel.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: AV fuel?

dialogues.speaker: DEPOT MANAGER
dialogues.text: Aviation fuel.  70. OFF CAM -- curious -- END SEQUENCE and CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike gets a drink out of the vending machine when his pho rings. It’s the TNT office.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Yeah. What do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cam, Daltrey and Sanchez around the speaker phone:

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: First code was an address for an aviation boneyard. Daltrey made two Albanians making off with a Harris Falcon radio. Foreman says it’s used to communicate with military aircraft only. Mike files that in his head.

dialogues.speaker: CAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Second code directed us to a fuel depot where another set of Albanians purchased 12,000 lbs of aviation fuel. Mike makes another note.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: And the last one?

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: We don’t know yet. We’re still trying to crack it, but it’s a different cipher than the others.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Alright, stay on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Bardha wraps up a call on his cell.

dialogues.speaker: BARDHA
dialogues.text: You're absolutely sure? (beat) Okay. Thanks for the call. Bardha hangs up. Climbs the stairs to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bardha enters. Looks to Hess.  71.

dialogues.speaker: BARDHA
dialogues.text: We got a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Night has fallen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus eats from a pudding cup in bed. Mike sits in a cha

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Man, I hate hospital food. Marcus tries to shoot the cup into the trash across the r

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Two points. The pudding cup come doesn’t even come close.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Wow, you really are a genuine slob.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: It’s not being a slob if it isn’t your house. Mike shakes his head. A beat, then to break the silence:

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Just like old times though. You, me, a stakeout. Mike agrees, but says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: .»+-You know, you should really give your new partner a break. I know you hate to admit it but he’s got skills.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: He’s a kid.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: So were we once. Mike takes that in as Marcus admits:

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You guys make a good team. Marcus looks away. Jealous, perhaps? Switching the subjec

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Talk to your family lately?  72.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I checked in on them this afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: How they holdin’ up?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Good... under the circumstances.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I missed them.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: They missed you.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Must be nice. Having someone to go home to. Marcus looks at him sideways.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Are you jealous, Mike? ‘Cause you can have ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Just sayin’. It’s been on my mind lately is all.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Mike Lowery wants to settle down? Better get one of those crash carts. Think I’m gonna have myself a heart attack. Now it’s Mike’s turn to look away. A beat, then:

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look, uhh, since we’re sharin’ n’ shit... I know you don’t think so, but I do miss the action sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: You're definitely getting your full of it this week.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Tell me about it.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: You didn’t have to quit. Marcus shrugs. What do you want from me?  73.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (sincerely) Why did you quit, Marcus? (no response) It wasn’t just Luga and the Albanians or the blood oath, was it?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Then why?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: You really wanna know?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I asked. Marcus sits up in the bed.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Respect. Mike’s thrown.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Every time we go into a situation, it’s all about what you want. I don’t get a say. And when you do it all head-on like you do, you’re puttin’ my life on the line. And after so long, it’s clear that you don’t care about me.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: And how do you think I felt? The person I counted on to save my life wasn’t there for me. “We ride together. We die together. Bad Boys for life.” That meant something to me. As Marcus absorbs that -- the two partners finally starti to reconcile -- MUSIC BUILDS and we GO TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A suburban speeds through downtown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bardha drives. An ALBANIAN GUNMAN loads a SIG-Sauer P220R  74.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DING! An elevator opens. Mike steps out. Moves down the h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The suburban approaches the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike looks in on a patient through a window: HOWARD -- st on life support. Mike regards him, quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Suburban pulls up. Parks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus tries to get some sleep, tossing and turning. DING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator opens up. Bardha and the Gunman exit. The Gu continues on alone. Bardha holds back, keeping an eye out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus sleeps. The room is dark. The Gunman comes in. Wal up to the bed. Aims the Sig when -- CLICK! Mike appears behind him, gun to the Gunman’s head. was in the closet.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Wrong patient, asshole. Miami PD. Marcus turns on the light and sits up in bed, adding:

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: And Burnett Services Unlimited.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Hands up and drop the gun. The Gunman raises his hands and drops the Sig. Mike goes to grab his wrist and -- LIGHTNING QUICK: the Gunman SNATCHES Mike’s -- causing Mike to FIRE at Marcus, bullet just exploding an IV bag beside him. The Gunman SLAMS Mike against the wall -- SHATTERING a TV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hearing the COMMOTION, Bardha BOOKS toward the room.  75.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and the Gunman go to BLOWS. Marcus makes a move for the fallen SIG. Bardha steps into room and aims at Marcus -- who quickly rolls off the bed. Mike and the Gunman continue to STRUGGLE. A DEATH MATCH. Moving so furiously that Bardha can’t get a clear shot. On the floor, Marcus reaches up. Pulls a TELEPHONE down f the bedside table. Rips out the cord. Bardha finally gets Mike in the cross-hairs. About to fir WHAM! Marcus BEAMS him with the telephone. Marcus LEAPS over the bed -- ass visible through the gown SLAMS himself into Bardha -- the two FALLING to the floor outside the room -- back into the hall. Mike and the Gunman trade punches, knees and elbows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus fights Bardha. Gets SLAMMED against a CRASH CART, impact causing the EKG DEFIBRILLATOR PADDLES to CHARGE. Marcus drops to the floor. Bardha gets on top. Starts cho him. Marcus grabs the defibrillator paddles. Puts them to Bardha’s chest and hits him with 250 volts. Bardha FLIES off Marcus, crashing onto his back, body SIZZLING.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Clear.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME MIKE
dialogues.text: trapped in a BEAR HUG. He SLAMS his head back into the Gunman’s nose. He DROPS Mike -- who picks up his gun, spins and CRACKS i over the Gunman’s head -- knocking him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike rushes out. Marcus gets to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: You alright?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Yeah. Mike looks up. Sees the NURSES at the front desk on the p with HOSPITAL SECURITY.  76.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (re: Bardha) This asshole led the hit team at the stadium. We gotta get him out of here before the uniforms come.

dialogues.speaker: SMASH TO
dialogues.text: MIKE -- taping Bardha up in medical tape -- head to toe l a mummy while:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus drives his Camaro to the service entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike drags a mummified Bardha to the laundry chute. His e widen as he sees what’s gonna happen to him.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Don’t worry. You can scream all you want. With that, Mike puts him inside --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and Bardha goes SLIDING down the tube -- into a LAUNDR CART in the hospital basement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike steps into an elevator -- as another elevator opens and MIAMI COPS step out, just missing him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Marcus carry the taped up Bardha over to Marcus' Camaro, toss him into the trunk and drive off. SMASH TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the entrance to the LION PIT, Mike unwraps several Big Macs and stuffs them inside Bardha’s clothes. Gagged, Bardha’s eyes do all the screaming.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: This is some sick ass shit right here.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: You didn’t say anything when I asked you to go to the drive-thru.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were buying me dinner, not no lion! Like “good job for not killing your suspect. Love, Mike.” I was touched.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Don’t worry. This is gonna be much more satisfying. Mike rips off the tape on Bardha’s mouth. He SCREAMS:

dialogues.speaker: BARDHA
dialogues.text: You better let me the fuck go!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Where’s Luga?

dialogues.speaker: BARDHA
dialogues.text: Fuck you! You won’t do shit to me.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: He taped your ass up and kidnapped you from a hospital. All he does is do shit to people!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: One last time.

dialogues.speaker: BARDHA
dialogues.text: (still defiant) I’m not telling you shit.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Your choice. Mike shoves the last Big Mac into Bardha’s pants. Bardha SCREAMS -- AHHHHH! -- as Mike picks him up.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Get his legs! (Marcus hesitates) Get his legs, Marcus! Marcus helps Mike hoist their prisoner up --

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Don’t ever say I don’t do shit for you again! -- and over the pit. A nearby lion ROARS!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Where’s Luga?

dialogues.speaker: BARDHA
dialogues.text: Pull me up! AHHH!  78. Smelling the Big Macs, the lion comes up. LEAPS. Mike and Marcus yank Bardha up just before the paw can tear him.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Oh shit -- did you see that!?!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (lowering Bardha back down ) WHERE’S LUGA!?!? Bardha is TERRIFIED now.

dialogues.speaker: BARDHA
dialogues.text: I DON’T KNOW! GET ME OUT, GET ME

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Oh, now you want something from me, huh? I’m suddenly your best friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another SCREAM as Mike and Marcus lower him back into the pit, the lion returning -- Mike yelling over Bardha:

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: WHAT’S HE HERE TO DO!?! OH MY GOD!!!

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: You better tell the man! That lion’s “da-da-da-da-dah -- lovin’ iti” The lion makes its way over to Bardha -- salivating.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Your people have been picking up equipment all over Miami. Fuel, a military radio -- what’s it for!?!

dialogues.speaker: BARDHA
dialogues.text: I SWEAR I DON’T KNOW! HE DOESN’T

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Who? The lion ROARS. Bardha FREAKS OUT!

dialogues.speaker: WHO
dialogues.text: The lion CHARGES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lion LUNGES -- but Mike and Marcus jerk Bardha out of pit and share a look. Alright, they got a name. Bardha tries to catch his breath, but he’s SHAKING. Mike takes out his phone. Pulls up a picture of the CODED LIST. Focuses on the final code -- the one that Cam and Daltrey couldn’t break.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: You’re gonna tell me how to break this code. OFF BARDHA -- caving:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The basement door opens to reveal Aleksander Luga, fired and ready to go. A team of ALBANIANS hop inside TWO TRUCKS, armed to the teeth, Luga about to join when Hess grabs his arm, warnin

dialogues.speaker: HESS
dialogues.text: Remember: you better not fuck this up. He meant to be intimidating, but Luga isn’t rattled. Neve is. Into his eyes -- showing Hess what intimidating is:

dialogues.speaker: LUGA
dialogues.text: That’s the last time you put your hand on me. Hess backs off. Smart move. Luga slams the door. Trucks r out -- MUSIC SPIKING as we GO TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Camaro ROCKETS up gravel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This time, Mike drives. Marcus white-knuckles the dashboa Into a speaker phone:

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: The final code is actually two different number sequences.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camera CIRCLES Daltrey and Sanchez around the speaker pho

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: First is a radio frequency for the the UHF Guard.  80.

dialogues.speaker: SANCHEZ
dialogues.text: UHF Guard?

dialogues.speaker: DALTREY
dialogues.text: It’s a way to establish communications between military and civilian aircrafts.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: The second’s coordinates. Longitude and latitude degrees: 40° 26’ 46'’ N 79° 58’ 56’’ E. Cam enters the coordinates into a computer. Pulls up a GO MAP IMAGE.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Coordinates are for a private airfield just outside the city. A BUS comes FLYING UP in the car windshield. Marcus SCREA

dialogues.speaker: BUS, BUS
dialogues.text: Mike twists the wheel, sparking over the median, dodging oncoming cars. Marcus tries not to hurl.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (piecing everything together .--quiet airfield, military radio, aviation fuel.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: What are you thinking, Mike?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Thinkin’ the FBI doesn’t know what’s up. Luga’s not here to doa drug deal. He’s here to doa hijacking. He’s a pilot, remember. Daltrey, how fast can you get your boys in the military on the phone?

dialogues.speaker: DALTREY
dialogues.text: Anytime day or night.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Do it now. Ask them if there’s any military aircrafts with the code- name “Forager"” coming into Florida tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Camaro exits the causeway -- gusting through traffic.  81.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daltrey hangs up a phone. Gets back on the call with Mike

dialogues.speaker: DALTREY
dialogues.text: Alright, just spoke to my pals in the Marine Reserves. Forager’s the NATO reporting name for an AN-124 Ruslan Transport Plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “FORAGER”, the transport plane, approaches the Florida co

dialogues.speaker: DALTREY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It’s carrying weapons that are being shipped to Eglin Air Force Base from Iraq.

dialogues.speaker: DALTREY
dialogues.text: M15 and M16 assault rifles. M40A1 Sniper Rifles. MP5s. Shoulder- launched missiles. Radar-cloaking technology. And at least 400,000 rounds of ammunition.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Jesus -- Luga’s gonna have enough hardware to take over a small country.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Or sell to one. We gotta go straight to the FBI on this. Cam, get Kessler and tell him Luga’s hijacking a military transport plane full of weapons.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Yeah, on it.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: And tell no one else at Miami PD about this.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: But Mike --

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Just do it. Mike hangs up. Marcus turns to Mike, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: You gonna cut out Miami PD?  82.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: If the leak’s coming from inside the department, I’m not tippin’ Luga off that we’re coming. Marcus isn’t sure. Mike drops the hammer, the car SPEEDIN AHEAD -- as we GO BACK TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daltrey and Sanchez slap on Kevlar. Cam’s on the phone wi the FBI.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: This is Cam Theroux, Miami PD badge number 3-4-9 Bravo 11-93, I need to speak to Agent Kessler right away. Cam’s put on hold. A figure appears in the doorway:

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What are you doing? It’s ELLIE. Cam looks up, busted.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: And where the hell is Lowery?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Camaro tops 90 -- as we GO VERY FAST TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back in the air with “Forager” -- making preparations for landing at Eglin Air Force Base.

dialogues.speaker: CONTROL TOWER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Control tower delta 5-0-7-9: calling “Forager” 302 on emergency channel. Switch over “Forager”.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several crates of MILITARY-GRADE WEAPONS are secured in t back. TWO PRIVATE MILITARY PILOTS sit up front. Switch ov to an EMERGENCY RADIO CHANNEL.

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: Control tower delta 5-0-7-9: this is “Forager" 302 over.

dialogues.speaker: CONTROL TOWER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Due to an incident at Eglin, we’re diverting you to an alternate airfield. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: CONTROL TOWER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Climb to 10,00 feet and turn to a heading of 2-8-5 degrees and proceed to coordinates 40° 26’ 46''

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where we see the person communicating with the plane via HARRIS PALMER MILITARY RADIO -- speaking in a PITCH-PERFE

dialogues.speaker: LUGA
dialogues.text: -- North 79° 58’ 56’’ East. At his feet, TWO DEAD CONTROL TOWER OPERATORS in pools of blood. We're:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A secluded airstrip outside Miami. Secured by Luga’s STRI TEAM. They stand watch with Heckler & Koch HK416 D10RS. L a military presence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pilots trade puzzled looks, then confirm:

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: Roger tower, 5-0-7-9 diverting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The transport plane diverts to Luga’s coordinates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Marcus continue to RACE to the airfield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luga sees the transport plane coming in from the clouds.

dialogues.speaker: PILOT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: “Forager” 302, 15 miles south, descending to 5,000.

dialogues.speaker: LUGA
dialogues.text: “Forager” 302, you are clear to land on runway 1-8. Luga then gets on his Nextel. Reports to his team:

dialogues.speaker: LUGA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Target’s en route. Get ready.  84.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The strike team COCK triggers, readying themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Camaro is moments away.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: You know, this car ain’t so bad. Marcus locks and loads his Glock.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: We should wait until back-up arrives.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Luga’s not waiting. Neither can we. He drops the hammer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “Forager” lands. When the engines CUT -- Luga and his tea RUSH the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seeing armed men approaching:

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: Holy shit. He tries raising the military on the radio -- but the sig is JAMMED. He only gets STATIC.

dialogues.speaker: CO-PILOT
dialogues.text: They're jamming the fucking signal!

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: Get your gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luga attaches a C-4 brick to a plane door. Activates a detonator. BOOM! The door BLOWS OFF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luga and his team STORM the plane. The co-pilot raises hi gun -- but a GUNMAN puts two muffled shots in his chest. aims a Tech-9 at the other pilot. Shoots him between the eyes.  85. VERY FAST: the team boards the plane. Load BARRELS contai 12,000 lbs of fuel. Dump the dead pilots out the open doo Luga sits down in the cockpit. Starts the engines back up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plane comes back to life as -- VROOOOM! -- the Camaro CRASHES through a perimeter gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seeing the Bad Boys coming -- Luga’s face TIGHTENS. He ru away from his seat -- grabbing a machine gun -- DRIVEN as gets to the open door --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and JUMPS OUT onto the runway. Fires madly at the Cama

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shower of bullets RIP through the windshield, SHATTERIN GLASS. Mike CRANKS the wheel --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and VEERS the car off the runway -- skidding to a stop near the tower -- Luga following it with his machine gun. INT. CAMARO — SAME Bullets RAIN IN. Marcus KICKS OPEN the passenger door and climbs out with Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Marcus duck behind the Camaro as Luga’s joined b THREE GUNMEN.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: There’s too many -- we need back- up, man!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Just cover me.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Mike, don’t -- But it’s too late. Mike’s already on his feet -- RACING a from the car -- and DIVING behind some runway equipment. He POPS BACK UP and SHOOTS THREE ROUNDS into another gunm killing him.  86. THREE MORE STRIKE TEAM MEMBERS get out of the plane, join Luga, concentrating gunfire on Mike who turns to look ove Marcus -- -- who remains crouched behind the Camaro -- a _ cell pho his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike -- eyes filling up with fury when he sees that Marcu isn't backing him up -- turns his attention back to Luga his men -- trading ear-piercing rounds.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME MARCUS
dialogues.text: on the phone with Cam, screaming over gunfire.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where the fuck are you at!?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanchez drives, topping 100 mph. Daltrey rides shotgun wh loading one. Cam sits in the back, phone to ear.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: We're still three minutes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullets STRIKE the plane. Fuel seeps out. A gunman FIRES at the tower windows above Marcus’s head. SHATTER. Glass RAINS down on Marcus -- -- who DIVES out of the way -- as CRASH! -- broken shards SPLATTER on the pavement -- almost shredding him. The gun battle RAGES ON. Another gunman tries to take Mike from his right side -- Mike turns -- shooting -- putting two in his chest -- the turning back to find: A THIRD GUNMAN taking aim -- Mike firing one shot that ri through his head. Mike soon gets the drop on Luga. He’s about to take him o when -- -- HE GETS HIT BY SPOTLIGHT -- blinding him as he fires, glare causing him to miss his target. A POLICE HELICOPTER SHOOTING OVERHEAD. Soon -- SEVERAL LOCAL POLICE CRUISERS ROAR UP TO THE SCEN Luga yells at his team to follow him back to the plane.  87.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luga hops inside and begins throwing open the military crates, pulling from them an ARSENAL OF MACHINE GUNS, GRENADES AND SHOULDER-FIRED MISSILES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the cruisers SCREAM UP, Mike and Marcus rise up from t ground -- about to move on the plane when -- LUGA AND HIS TEAM COME BACK OUT -- re-armed -- unloading wealth of gunfire that SHREDS the incoming police cars. Luga takes a MANPAD: a shoulder-launched surface-to-air missile -- sets it down on his shoulder, peers through th sights and FIRES A MISSILE that EXPLODES the tail of the police helicopter -- causing it to SPIN WILDLY. Cops SCATTER as the helicopter BLOWS in an ERUPTION of fi and metal that nearly takes them all out. The Escalade soon ROARS UP. Cam, Sanchez and Daltrey hop of the car and join in on the action -- firing bravely. Mike and Marcus are still trading gunfire with Luga and h men -- but they are out-numbered and out-gunned. The arrival of additional police cruisers -- along with a SWAT VAN -- forces Luga back into the plane --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- where he sits down at the controls -- steering the pla

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The transport plane TURNS. Starts down the runway. Mike g CHARGING after it on foot. Marcus tries to stop him:

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: But Mike doesn’t listen -- his arms pumping -- running li mad man after the escaping plane. Cam also sees this, but unlike Marcus, he JOINS IN -- run over to a cruiser and ROARING after Mike. Cops OPEN FIRE on the plane, but Luga keeps going. As doe Mike. But the plane is picking up speed. Then -- Cam SHOOTS UP in the cruiser -- moving past Mike on the r side -- then SLAMS to a stop so Mike can catch up. Cam throws open the passenger door -- and screams out:  88.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Get in! Mike hops inside the car and Cam PEELS OFF after Luga.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Luga gets ready to take off --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Cam pulls the cruiser up to the open plane door. Mike out at the plane. Opens fire -- BANG! BANG! BANG!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An Albanian gets shot. Another fires back at Mike. Luga p back on the wheel --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and the plane TAKES OFF. Mike continues to fire -- but Cam is almost out of runway SLAMS on the brakes. The car screeches to a stop as the transport plane rises disappears into the clouds. Mike steps out of the car, watching Luga escape -- as we

dialogues.speaker: AGENT KESSLER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: According to the DOD, the weapons were all set to be repurposed upon arrival in Florida.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone's present -- listening to Kessler. Tensions are high.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT KESSLER
dialogues.text: The MANPADS that were on board is a man-portable air-defense system, shoulder-launched surface-to-air missile. It can take down planes, helicopters, drones. The black market value of these latest versions is staggering and the introduction of them into the terrorist marketplace has enormous national security implications that are only too frightening to imagine. (to Mike and Marcus) You just armed the enemy.  89. Mike and Marcus take issue, but before they can get in Kessler’s face about it --

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: Agent Kessler, my officers --

dialogues.speaker: AGENT KESSLER
dialogues.text: (cutting her off) Are out of your control. (re: Mike) He is out of control.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (getting in his face) You fuckin’ kiddin’ me, man?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Mike, calm down.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: No. Fuck that. At every turn this mother fucker’s been up my ass even though we've been doin’ his job.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT KESSLER
dialogues.text: No one asked you to, Lowery. Luga’s operation was a Federal investigation. Miami PD was supposed to back off --

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: We called you right when the shit was goin’ down and if we didn’t act, we wouldn’t have even had a chance at stoppin’ Luga.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT KESSLER
dialogues.text: But you didn’t stop him! You let him get away!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE AGENT KESSLER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No, no, you ain’t putting the If Luga gets out of the blame on us. country with those weapons, it’s on YOU and I’m gonna have your fucking badge, cock- sucker! Kessler pushes Mike -- who doesn’t stand for that. He com back harder -- angrier -- hitting Kessler back -- causing CHAOS TO ERUPT -- Feds vs Miami PD. Mike throws a punch at Kessler -- CONNECTING with his jaw Another agent goes after Mike -- activating Marcus who gr him. Pulls him back. This is getting out of control. Cam, Daltrey and Sanchez pull Mike and Marcus away as Kes screams at his men:  90. AGENT KESSLER (CONT’D) That’s it! Take them both into custody right now! The FEDERAL AGENTS backing up Kessler grab Mike and Marcu Force them out the door. AGENT KESSLER (CONT’D) (wiping blood from his lip) This isn’t a police station. It’s a fucking zoo. And your men --

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: (not backing down; defending Mike and Marcus) My men are the only ones without their heads squarely up their own asses. And if you dare try to lay any of tonight’s blame on them or anyone else at Miami PD, I’m gonna dedicate my life to ruining yours. And we see she means it. But Kessler gets the final word:

dialogues.speaker: AGENT KESSLER
dialogues.text: If Luga gets away... it’s your ass, too. Kessler moves past her. OFF ELLIE, face tightening:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two government sedans speed past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agents escort Mike and Marcus into the basement of the FB Miami office -- moving them down a row of EMPTY CELLS.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: This is bullshit! I want my phone call. I want my lawyer. I want all your fuckin’ names -- ‘cause I’m gonna have each and every one of your asses. The two are locked in adjoining cells. Mike sits on a ben

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Man, can you believe this shit?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Fuck you, Marcus.  91.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: What? (off Mike’s silence) Whoa. Hold up. You’re mad at me now?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I needed you to back me up at the airfield --

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: No, no, no. Fuck that. You ain’t puttin’ this shit on me.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: You still don’t get it. I looked for you and you were nowhere to be found.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: And once again, you didn’t listen to me and look where we’re at now.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Kiss my ass, Marcus. Mike looks away. Fuck this guy. A beat, then softly:

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: «.+-you know somethin’, Mike? You Say you want a partner. But I don’t think you do. You like the one man army thing too much. (beat) How’s that workin’ out for you? Mike stays quiet. No comeback. Marcus sits down. Says not either. As Marcus's words hang:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First light starting to shine, CAMERA SHOOTS over wetland arrive at a COASTAL LAND MASS where Luga has set down the transport plane -- punctured with bullet holes, out of fu Luga supervises his remaining men throwing a CAMOUFLAGE T over the plane -- covering it from an overhead surveillan Moments later, several GO-FAST BOATS zip up to the plane 150 mph. A group of ALBANIANS step off to meet Luga, led Hess -- who is not happy. QUICK CUTS: the men transfer the weapons onto the go-fast boats. Hess TEARS into Luga.  92.

dialogues.speaker: HESS
dialogues.text: I told you: this was not a personal job. It’s business. You were supposed to take off immediately from the airfield! NOT go after those two cops! But as before -- Luga doesn’t appear like he’s listening.

dialogues.speaker: HESS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And because of your bullshit, the FBI, Customs, Homeland, Miami PD -- they’re all looking for the plane and I have to fix this. This is a multi-million dollar arms sale! Now I have to get these weapons on the container -- Luga STRIKES -- quick-punching Hess right in the throat, BREAKING his wind pipe. He can’t even cry out. Only his e SCREAM as his knees drop to the wet ground. Luga PRESSES HIS THUMBS into Hess’s eyes -- PUSHING them until they BLEED -- but of course -- he STILL CAN'T YELL. Hess crashes to the ground. He can’t even see Luga stand him -- draw his gun and fire a bullet into his STOMACH. Luga looks over to Hess’s men, gun in hand. They look bac him, still. A beat -- then they get back to work -- putting the weapo onto the boats. They’re not gonna cross Luga. Hess, still on the ground, bleeding out slowly, in agony, only listen as Luga and the men finish up, get on the boa and speed away, disappearing. OFF HESS, living death:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Marcus are still cooling their heels in jail whe door opens at the end of the hall and Ellie comes stormin down the hall. A FEDERAL GUARD stops her.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Hey, can I help --

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: (not slowing down) Absolutely. You can open up these cells and let my boys out.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: I'm afraid I can’t do that.  93.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: Well, I see your authority and raise you a Federal judge’s. Ellie flashes a COURT ORDER in his face. She means busine

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now open the fucking cells. The guard -- no choice -- releases Marcus first -- who tu to Ellie on his way out.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Away from him. He leaves without a word to Mike, who then gets let out o his cell. Steps up to Ellie.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Knew someone would bail us out. Didn't think it would be you.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: (recalling what Mike told her earlier about respect) Nobody gets to boss my people around except me. He nods. Thanks. Then as he goes:

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Lowery. Mike stops. Turns back to her.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t think this means you’re off the hook with me. But there’s no time. (an order) Make this right. Mike locks eyes with her. Absolutely, lieutenant. Leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kessler and his agents grill Bardha, cuffed to a table.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT KESSLER
dialogues.text: Tell us right now: where the fuck can we find Luga?

dialogues.speaker: BARDHA
dialogues.text: I already told you: I don’t know!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A battering ram OBLITERATES the front door. An FBI SWAT T rushes inside -- but the factory is completely ABANDONED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike overlooks the building from afar. Watches the FBI mo in and out, searching for any evidence they can find. His phone BUZZES.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Lowery.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Mike, it’s Luttrell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luttrell comes driving up in his Buick -- nervous, anxiou

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: We need to talk. Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Checking up on a lead.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: You turn up anything?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Not yet.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Well, I have. I found out who told Luga about the Red Roof Inn.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Not on the phone. We need to meet face to face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIME LAPSE as day gives way to night.  95.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike’s Ferrari arrives at an INDUSTRIAL AREA near the riv He gets out. Looks around. Sees a boat shed, but no Luttr A beat later and a car approaches. We think it’s Luttrell but the driver steps out -- IT’S MARCUS.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Luttrell called. Said you needed to see me. Mike instinctively knows it’s a set up and TACKLES Marcus the ground as -- BANG! -- a bullet rips through the air a strikes a gas tank behind our them. BOOOOOOOOM! It ERUPTS! Shockwave sends Mike and Marcus SOARING -- then crashing back to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: LUGA
dialogues.text: and a trio of HITMEN emerge from behind a stack of rustin marine parts nearby. Mike quickly gets to his feet. Helps Marcus up. Bullets chasing them, they SPRINT across a wooden dock -- to the SHED atop the water. They BOMB through the door as the wood walls gets SPLINTE with rounds. Luga readies a Heckler & Koch HK69Al1 Grenade Launcher. Mike slams the door to the boat shed. Marcus peers out a dirty window. Sees Luga aiming the grenade launcher.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mike! Mike spies a SCUBA TANK on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Take that! Luga pulls back the trigger. Mike throws open a small hatch in the floor to get to the water below the shed. The grenade from Luga’s gun FIRES into the shed. BOOOOOOOOOM! -- the entire shed EXPLODES! Wood and fire g every which way.  96. Luga watches the blackened pieces fall from the star-lit then goes over to see what remains of Mike and Marcus. But there are no remains. Only charred wooden planks. Luga looks out at the river. Their bodies must've been bl out to the river. He waits there a moment, staring out. S nothing. An Albanian hitman says what all is thinking.

dialogues.speaker: HITMAN
dialogues.text: They’re dead. But Luga refuses to take that for an answer. He grabs the machine gun out of the hitman’s hands and op fire on the water -- FURIOUS. Screams at the others to:

dialogues.speaker: LUGA
dialogues.text: Get some lights now! The gunmen focus flashlight beams on the water. Luga want see bodies -- but all he sees is BLACKNESS. Convinced that they’re dead -- that no one could’ve survi that blast or stay under water that long -- Luga turns an leaves -- ROARING AWAY in a nearby speed boat. Another moment passes -- then Mike and Marcus appear from under the water -- sharing the oxygen in the SCUBA TANK. Moments later, the two collapse on shore, exhausted. Marc turns to Mike, appreciative.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: ...Thanks. Mike nods.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Luttrell set us up. Marcus spits out some salt water.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Well, I’m definitely down for beatin’ his ass. You? The two get to their feet -- as we GO FAST TO: INT. LUTTRELL’S HOME - NIGHT The front door EXPLODES OPEN! Mike and Marcus RUSH inside They look around, but the house is EMPTY. No Luttrell.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: He’s gone.  97. Mike tries to find a clue, any clue, but there’s NOTHING.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Shit! Mike’s phone rings. He puts it on speaker.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. MIAMI-DADE P.D. HEADQUARTERS - LUTTRELL’S OFFICE - S Daltrey and Sanchez search Luttrell’s office. Cam has FINANCIAL RECORDS up on Luttrell’s computer.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: I hacked Luttrell’s Internal Affairs password and ran a Dun and Bradstreet check on him. Eight years ago, the asshole was on his second divorce, had child payments, alimony, was dead broke.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Lemme guess: out of nowhere he’s suddenly got enough cash to pay off his bills.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: All coming from a second bank account in his son’s name.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Eight years. That’s before he was internal affairs. What was he back then?

dialogues.speaker: SANCHEZ
dialogues.text: Robbery Homicide...Overtown.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Overtown. Isn’t that where Luga’s family used to call home?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Luga must’ve gotten Luttrell on the take early. (urgent) Cam, Luttrell’s drivin’ a Miami PD vehicle. It’s got LoJack. If I’m right, wherever he’s at, Hess won't be far behind. Get me an address! MUSIC SPIKES and we SLAM TO:  98.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ESTABLISH. Filled with ships of all sizes. MUSIC PULSING, Luga supervises large CRANES filling the h of a CONTAINER SHIP -- THE “OSAKA SPIRIT” -- with dumpste sized VESSELS. Luttrell is with him -- making a plea:

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Look, I’ve given you everything you want, but as soon as you’re gone, I’m done. No more. You understand? Luga doesn’t even pay him the courtesy of eye contact.

dialogues.speaker: LUGA
dialogues.text: I understand we have an arrangement and when it ends isn’t for you to decide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: seeing this. Mike, Marcus, Cam, Sanchez and Daltrey over Luga’s operation from a concealed distance.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (looking through the binoculars) I see Luga. He’s with Luttrell. Shit. They’re getting ready to leave.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: (taking the binoculars) There's gotta be fifteen, twenty guys with him. Maybe more inside.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: We have to move fast. Keep the ship at port until customs and back-up arrives. Daltrey, Sanchez: you two take the port side. Cam, you’re mid- ship. Lay down enough cover fire to buy me time to get to the bridge. The younger cops nod. On it. Mike sees Marcus. Pauses.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...That work for you? Marcus nods. Good of him to ask.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Yeah.  99.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Then let’s do it. QUICK CUTS: the team gears up: weapons prep/rounds are seated: KA-CLICK/Kevlar vests strapped on. Mike turns to

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You ready for this?

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: I think I am.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: So do I. Cam smiles. A healing moment. Off which:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A loud horn BLOWS. Luga’s ship is about to leave. Luttrel about to step off the boat when we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: working the controls from inside his booth. The butt of a STRIKES him across the back of the head -- knocking him o Cam takes his place in the booth. Gives the lever a hard YANK, RELEASING a container from its hook. It CRASHES down onto the deck of the ship -- Luttrell and Luga’s CREW DIVING ASIDE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gunman sounds the general alarm. SHOOTERS grab weapons step out onto the deck to investigate as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VERY FAST: Mike and Marcus ROAR UP to the ship in Mike’s Ferrari -- SCREAMING up a ramp -- and FLYING their ride o the main deck -- PLOWING DOWN two gunmen in the process. Luttrell sees them and quickly BOLTS inside the ship as - Daltrey and Sanchez ZIP-LINE onto the top deck on cables while FIRING -- hitting gunmen. Mike and Marcus throw open car doors and immediately enga in a fire fight. Mike covers Marcus -- screaming at him t

dialogues.speaker: GO, GO
dialogues.text: Marcus fires his way inside an open hatch, into the ship.  100. Mike trades rounds with gunmen -- before running through same door -- joining Marcus inside:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They go TEARING DOWN the narrow hallway. At an intersecti

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I'll take the bridge. You take the engine room.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: On it. Mike goes left. Marcus goes right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daltrey and Sanchez find themselves pinned down by enemy gunfire -- ducking behind one of the steel containers. Two gunmen ADVANCE -- about to get a clear shot when -- CAM climbs up the anchor on the side of the ship -- pulli himself onto the deck behind the gunmen.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Hands in the air! The gunmen turn, but keep firing. Cam shoots back -- his blast of bullets killing them both. But then -- RAT-TAT-TAT-TAT! -- MORE MACHINE GUNFIRE forces Cam to dr back behind some containers of his own -- as we RETURN TO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GUNMAN comes out of a compartment -- ATTACKING Mike. They wrestle for control of Mike’s gun. Mike draws a knif from his tactical vest and JAMS IT into the gunman. He drops. Mike continues on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus moves into a new hallway -- checking open compartm doors -- when: A GUNMAN JUMPS OUT INTO THE CORRIDOR -- down the hall fro him -- firing. Marcus shoots back -- tagging him first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullets continue to trade air between Luga’s gunmen and t TNT cops. BANG! Daltrey takes one in the chest. Goes FLYI back into a container.  101.

dialogues.speaker: SANCHEZ
dialogues.text: Daltrey! A gunman takes aim at Sanchez, but she fires first -- kil him -- as Cam takes out another gunman -- giving Sanchez opening to rush over to Daltrey -- scared. But then she sees -- his Kevlar caught the bullet. Daltre winces, nodding:

dialogues.speaker: DALTREY
dialogues.text: I’m okay. Sanchez helps him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fleet of police cruisers CHARGE toward the docks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back with Marcus -- still making his way to the engine ro The ship is MASSIVE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a SHOOTER rounds a corner and -- CRACK! -- Mike is the to LAY HIM OUT with a straight shot to his head. He then grabs his H&K machine gun and continues on when - BULLETS EXPLODE AROUND HIM. Mike ducks back. Swings his h around a corner. Sees:

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: firing. Mike shoots back -- then gives chase down a hallw Luttrell turns and fires back at Mike until -- CLICK! -- runs out of bullets. He quickly ducks into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And gets over to a desk -- as Mike steps inside -- aiming gun at him. Luttrell freezes.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Turn your ass around! Luttrell turns, his back now to the desk.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: (pleading) Mike, please, you gotta understand. I had no choice. Luga was gonna kill me if I didn’t help him. You gotta believe me.  102.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: You're a goddamn traitor. I don’t have to do shit but take your ass in. But Luttrell is merely stalling -- his hands (unseen by M grabbing a Glock off the desk. He swings it around. He wo be taken in. Gives Mike no choice but to -- BANG! BANG! BANG! Put three holes in Luttrell’s chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus steps inside. Takes in the massive diesel engine, boilers. Is at a total loss.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: What the fuck am I suppose to -- He stops himself and moves over to the equipment.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fuck it. And just starts throwing levers, hoping to shut the engin down. Eventually, the huge engine SCREAMS and comes to a STOP. Marcus cheers.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hell, yeah, go Captain Burnett!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back with Mike -- heading down another set of stairs and hall -- stepping past a door when -- A TRIGGER IS COCKED! Mike spins. Comes face to face with gunman, about to make a move when -- A SECOND GUN APPEARS from behind him. Gets pressed into t back of his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike is dragged into the hold by two gunmen. Another two already inside -- along with Luga. Mike’s knees get kicked out from behind him. He drops. Lu stands over him. Loving this.

dialogues.speaker: LUGA
dialogues.text: Sergeant Lowery. He levels his gun at Mike’s head.

dialogues.speaker: LUGA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where’s your friend?  103.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME MARCUS
dialogues.text: continuing through the ship, stopping when he hears VOICE He follows them. Comes up to the entrance to the hold. He sees Luga keeping his gun on Mike. Counts the other gunmen. Shit. He’s so out-numbered. He ducks back into another compartment. Dials Cam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Cam is occupied, mid-gun battle with the remaining gu on the outer deck of the ship, COPS joining in.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME MARCUS
dialogues.text: hanging up.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Shit. He checks his ammo. Half a mag. Thinks -- as TIME SLOWS D

dialogues.speaker: RESUME MIKE
dialogues.text: as Luga COCKS his trigger, about to execute him.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME MARCUS
dialogues.text: as he weighs his options, coming to the only conclusion h can reach -- his face TIGHTENING, eyes going STEELY, cour RISING, blood PUMPING and he --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gunmen look up as Marcus rushes inside. Bullets start FLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus DROPS, ROLLS and COMES BACK UP -- SHOOTING BACK. K two gunmen instantly -- then shoots a third as -- -- Mike springs into action. Grabs a fallen dead gunman’s weapon and kills the fourth gunman but -- -- LUGA_GETS THE DROP ON MARCUS -- getting behind him and holding a gun to his head -- while using him as a HUMAN SHIELD against Mike. Mike pauses -- locking eyes with Marcus -- his friend -- danger -- then Luga -- his enemy.

dialogues.speaker: LUGA
dialogues.text: Your gun -- put it down. Mike considers.  104.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Don't do it, Mike.

dialogues.speaker: LUGA
dialogues.text: Do it now!

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Don’t you fucking do it! Mike debates.

dialogues.speaker: LUGA
dialogues.text: Drop it!

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS LUGA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He’s gonna kill us both! PUT THE FUCKING GUN DOWN! Mike locks eyes with Marcus. A choice must be made. A bea then -- Mike drops the gun, choosing Marcus over himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luga then aims his gun at Mike -- but before he can shoot -- Marcus swings his arm back -- knocking Luga’s arm asid He then gets up to his feet and spins -- as Luga levels h gun again -- Marcus --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike’s eyes SCREAM as Marcus drops down in front of him. Luga takes aim at Mike -- who RUSHES him -- moving so fas that Luga can’t even get a shot off before Mike CRASHES I HIM. Luga’s gun FLIES ASIDE. And as Marcus BLEEDS OUT beside him -- Mike HURLS PUNCHES at Luga -- one after the other -- RAGI But Luga takes the blows -- before landing a closed-fist Mike’s jaw that stuns him. Then Mike draws his blade and swings it -- the knife SLIC Luga’s arm -- causing blood to spray. Enraged -- Luga throws a flurry of mixed martial arts tha catch Mike off-guard -- punches knocking him to the groun Right beside Luga’s gun. He makes a grab for it -- as Lug DARTS out the hatch -- disappearing before Mike can shoot Mike then turns back to his partner and rushes over, drop down beside him and turning him onto his back.  105.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Marcus -- Marcus! He sees Marcus is bleeding bad -- but still alive -- his breathing LABORED. He doesn’t have a lot of strength -- or time -- but he st manages to whisper to Mike to:

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Kill that fucker. Mike nods -- committed -- then hurries out with Luga’s gu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Running -- Mike gets back on his radio to:

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Theroux. EXT. CONTAINER SHIP —- SAME Cam, backed by Daltrey, Sanchez and the wave of new cops the scene, take the remaining gunmen into custody.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Go Mike.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME MIKE
dialogues.text: heading down the hall, searching.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Marcus is down. He’s in the hold. Lower deck. Get medics down to him now.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: On it. He calls for back-up as we --

dialogues.speaker: RESUME MIKE
dialogues.text: still on the move -- but stopping when he sees a BLOOD SM on the hatch that leads to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike moves inside, gun up. A FIRE AXE GETS SWUNG AT HIM. Mike DUCKS -- but Luga swings again -- KNOCKING the gun a  106. He goes to hack Mike a third time -- but Mike catches the handle before the axe connects with his face. The two struggle for control and in the battle -- the axe goes free -- in the opposite direction of Mike’s gun. Luga knocks Mike down to the floor -- and locks his legs around his head -- CHOKING HIM. Mike tries prying Luga’s legs free but his grip is too TI Mike’s arms search for something -- finding a tool box. Rummaging around -- he locates a SCREWDRIVER and STABS LU IN THE LEG WITH IT. Luga HOWLS and releases his grip. Mike scurries away -- o of breath. Luga looks behind him. Sees Mike’s gun. He goes to make a grab for it. Mike sees this. Knows he has one move left. That's when he spies: THE FIRE AXE. He picks it up just as Luga takes Mike’s gu turning to aim as -- Mike LAUNCHES the axe -- throwing it across the room at L

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luga’s STUNNED. He can’t even bring himself to fire. He SLUMPS to the floor -- locking eyes with Mike as he dr - before keeling over -- DEAD. OFF MIKE -- bloodied and exhausted:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MEDICAL HELICOPTER comes in for a landing. Mike comes rushing out a hatch -- onto the main deck. He looks around. Sees Marcus on a stretcher -- loaded into t helicopter, its doors shutting. No words. Just MUSIC. Mike hurries past his fellow office and off the boat as the helicopter FLIES OFF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike commandeers a police cruiser -- slams the door -- hi the gas -- and ROARS OFF as we BEGIN AN INTERCUT WITH:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The med chopper shoots past while --  107.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Mike’s stolen cruiser blows through traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EMS works on stabilizing Marcus, calling in his vitals to emergency room doctors as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Mike continues to weave in and out of cars -- racing t meet Marcus at the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the helicopter touches down -- ER STAFF there to greet Marcus -- hurrying him inside the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back with Mike, finding another gear, rocketing forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOCTORS cut open Marcus’s clothes -- exposing his bullet wound. It doesn’t look good as they get to work...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike ROARS UP in the cruiser -- and rushes inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike arrives at the curtain area where Marcus is being treated. But before he can get close, a NURSE cuts him of

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: Sir, you're gonna have to wait outside. But Mike protests:

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: That’s my partner in there! He tries to look past the curtains -- but only sees Marcu legs and the doctors scrambling to save him.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: Please, get back, let the doctors do their job. Mike -- no choice -- backs off.  108. And as he leaves -- we hold on his POV: his partner and friend -- obscured by the curtain -- fighting for his lif Off which -- FADE OUT. A beat, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s the next day. Mike sits in a chair across from Marcu asleep in a bed -- alive, but still in critical condition FADE OUT. INT. MIAMI GENERAL HOSPITAL —- ROOM — DAY Mike is now asleep. Days have since passed. He slowly sti eyes focusing on: THE BED. But it’s now EMPTY. Marcus is GONE. Where did he For a moment, we may think he’s dead -- but then -- A TOILET FLUSHES off-camera. Mike whips around to find: MARCUS -- stepping out of the bathroom -- moving slowly b to his bed.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Fair warning, Mike: keep clear of the bathroom for at least an hour.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doin’, man? You know your ass ain’t supposed to get out of bed. Marcus struggles to get back into bed. Mike helps.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know...I never did thank you for what you did on that ship.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: No...you didn’t. (beat) But you don’t have to. That’s what partners are for. Mike looks at Marcus, sincere:

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry I didn’t respect you enough.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I’m sorry you didn’t either.  109. Mike smiles.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We ride together.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: We die together.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE/MARCUS
dialogues.text: Bad Boys for life. They both smile. About to embrace --

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Marcus Burnett, what are you doing out of bed? Mike and Marcus turn. The BURNETT FAMILY steps inside, carrying get well balloons and flowers.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, baby. Mike said it was okay.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: No, no, you ain’t layin’ that shit on me. His family rushes over -- helping him. He sees the flower

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Man, how many flowers do I need?

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: These are from the FBI.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Kiss asses. A KNOCK at the door. Mike and Marcus turn to see Ellie.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: Got room for a few more guests? She then steps aside to allow -- CAPTAIN HOWARD to move inside the room -- walking with the use of a cane.
