dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN HOWARD
dialogues.text: Well, well, well, it wasn’t good enough that I got shot -- you assholes had to end up in the hospital, too.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE/MARCUS
dialogues.text: Hey Captain! Good to see you, man! Howard crosses up to his Bad Boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was some good cop work you did. The both of you. Mike and Marcus nod.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: So when did the doctors say you could get back to bein’ captain, Captain?

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN HOWARD
dialogues.text: About a month or so. But I may stretch that a bit... since I know the department’s in good hands. 110. That's in reference to Ellie -- who locks eyes with Mike. this time, she can’t hold back a smile. Maybe there is a future for them...? CAPTAIN HOWARD (CONT’D) What about you two?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: What about us what?

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN HOWARD
dialogues.text: The Bad Boys. They back together or gone for good? Mike and Marcus turn to each other -- then Marcus looks t Theresa for permission. She looks back at him -- then nods. It’s okay with me. Marcus smiles and returns to Mike. Shrugs. I’m in if you

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: ... What about Cam?

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE
dialogues.text: Cam’s a good cop. He’ll be an even better one without your influence. Mike looks back to Marcus. The classic Inner Circle song starts to come up on soundtrack -- as we GO TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike pushes Marcus in a wheelchair -- away from us -- the of them awash with Miami sunshine.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Look, if Bad Boys 2.0 is gonna happen, there’s gotta be some ground rules. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: From now on, we’re gonna talk about every move before we make it, you understand.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Fine... on one condition.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Anything.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: We burn every last one of your stupid ass skinny jeans.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: But, Mike man, that’s my look.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: And you look like an idiot. If we’re gonna be partners again, you’re gonna have to dress the part. The two continue on like that, playfully jabbing each oth the best of friends -- the Inner Circle song playing on a

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Go, go, go, go, go, go! We HEAR a dashboard siren, squealing tires and horn BLAST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in the midst of a high-speed pursuit -- Mike’s BRAN NEW Ferrari ROCKETING through traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flashing SIRENS of cruisers light up Mike’s face.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Better tell FHP this is us before they start shootin’ the tires. As Mike rips back over the median, the engine roars at a downshift and the speedometer drops.  112.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: That’s it!? You slowing down?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I’m doing 85 in a school zone.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Eighty-five? Man, I used to know a cop named Mike Lowrey. Didn’t even sober up ‘til he hit a hundred. Mike shoots through a red light; cars skid in his wake.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: School kids, crossing guards, they'd be stuck in the fender. You still the baddest cop? Drive like it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ferrari screeches to a stop. Mike and Marcus bomb out Rush up. Marcus punches the door.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Marcus Burnett -- open up! The door swings open. We expect a crack dealer or somethi but instead we get an EARTHMOTHER. Mike and Marcus were racing to get to the WATER BIRTH of Marcus’s grandson. We see Theresa is also there.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Congratulations. Grandpa.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: It’s a boy. It’s a boy, Marcus! Marcus is humbled.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Bad Boys, bad boys, what’chu gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Quit it, Mike. That shit ain’t appropriate no more.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I gotta film this. Mike pulls out Marcus’s camcorder (which he’ll have taken from the car) and turns it on. We HEAR:

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (ON THE CAMERA MONITOR)
dialogues.text: Oh Sgt. Burnett, YES, YES!  113. Marcus's eyes go wide like SAUCERS.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Oh FUCK! Mike immediately sees the sex tape is of a much better quality than the previous version. No longer shaking.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Okay, finally some production value.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: (taking the camera back) I’m gonna kick your ass.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Looks like you didn’t need my help after all. Marcus kills the camera. END.
